headline: Azie Tesfai On Becoming The First Actor To Write An Episode For ‚ÄòSupergirl‚Äô: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs Incredibly Personal‚Äô
summary: Azie Tesfai discusses becoming a superhero and breaking new ground as a writer.
bodytext: (CBS) ‚Äì   Supergirl  returns tonight with an all-new episode on The CW at 9/8c. In tonight‚Äôs episode, titled ‚ÄúBlind Spots,‚Äù Kelly Olsen assumes the role of Guardian. Azie Tesfai, who plays Kelly Olsen, also wrote this episode marking the first time an actor has written for a Greg Berlanti show. CBS ‚Äò Matt Weiss spoke to Tesfai about her groundbreaking opportunity and what it‚Äôs like to become a superhero. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured MW-  Hello Azie! Congratulations on the new episode of  Supergirl  coming out tonight on The CW at 9/8c. You got the opportunity to become the first actor to actually write an episode for a Greg Berlanti show for this one. How does that feel? AT-  I didn‚Äôt know I was the first until I was well into writing it, which is probably a good thing. It‚Äôs amazing. I had a really lovely conversation with Greg after and I feel very lucky that I got to be the first and that this character, specifically becoming a superhero and stepping into her power, It all feels very serendipitous. I feel lucky that I get to be the person to do it. MW-  How do you think it would have been different if you had known? AT-  Yeah, probably a freak out or two [Laughs]. This is a lot of pressure, I wouldn‚Äôt have wanted to mess this up. I can‚Äôt be the last and so I if I don‚Äôt get this right I could be. I don‚Äôt want to mess this opportunity up or somebody else coming in and saying I want to write and they‚Äôre like, we‚Äôve tried this, we‚Äôre not doing this anymore. I had already written a sample script for  Supergirl  that I sent to my show runners and they loved it and sent it to Warner Brothers and our producer Greg Berlanti, and they signed off on me writing an episode. I also did the writers room for a month. So I joined the writers room and did the whole 10 to five day, which I‚Äôm a big fan, especially during COVID, because we did a virtual writing room. So I was in my pajamas like, constantly and then just put some sort of sweater that felt presentable and had all my food and my snacks and my dog. It was like a dream, I‚Äôm like, I could live this, [Laughs]. Like I don‚Äôt know why I‚Äôm going to set and getting my hair makeup done every day, I could do this. But so that was amazing and then I found out that I was going to write the episode and actually become a superhero; that just blew me away. Then I found out I was the first one to write an episode. So it was good it didn‚Äôt all happen at the same time because I think I might have just not been able to go through the process the same way. MW-  That‚Äôs a good point it‚Äôd be scary to know all that ahead of time. You‚Äôre the first and you don‚Äôt want to be the last. When you get to set and it‚Äôs time to shoot the episode what was that like putting on the suit for the first time? AT-  Emotional, which I was very surprised by the first time you put on your own supersuit it‚Äôs like a power you didn‚Äôt know you had. You just stand a little taller, it really is a game changer in your confidence, you walk differently. It‚Äôs not a normal thing to go to work and put on a superhero suit. Laughs]. So I think I underestimated how how special it was. Our team was wonderful and allowed me to be involved in the design process of the suit. To actually also see it in its final form from the animation that we started with was incredible. We had started two years before initially, before COVID, and then we had six full months to actively develop it with the studio here in LA. We worked with Ironhead who also did the Wonder Woman costume and Batman and I was geeking out non stop pretty much of how cool the process was to make a suit. MW-  Was it a different experience on set for an episode you wrote yourself? AT-  It was very shocking and jarring in the best way. I think from the beginning of writing it to being there on set, just even little things like the signage of a store. I would be like oh my gosh I came up with that! Then I‚Äôd take 100 selfies and photos with it. It was very surreal the whole thing. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn MW-  That‚Äôs really funny you got this job as an actor, you write an episode, become a superhero; but when you look back it‚Äôs the improvement in your posture and the prop store signs you were most excited about [Laughs]. AT:  [Laughs] Everyone thought I was nuts but it is a wild thing to think of a name of something and then see it. It really was a dream come true. MW-  You mentioned you collaborated on the design of the suit. So what parts of the suit were specifically you? AT-  The hair makeup we worked really closely together and so doing the braids was something that I felt lucky that we had an idea with it and they approved it right away. I always wanted to do the half helmet because of the comics and the gold. The gold was pretty quickly approved and then the half helmet logistically, there were concerns like can we do this? Doing stunts and stuff in this but Ironhead was amazing, they figured it out. Then once we had that foundation and the character was visible there were all these other little things that I wanted to do. Things like little gold pieces, the braids, and little accents. They really let me go for it and loved all of the ideas. The costume designers really were great at making it usable too because that‚Äôs something I hadn‚Äôt thought about. Thing like wearing it after lunch, having interview at home, or like, if I decide to hydrate that day making sure it‚Äôs gonna like a lot to take off. You sit in that costume for like 15 hours every day and I was one of the last costumes that needed to be developed so I got the benefit of taking care of all the issues everyone else had for mine. I am by far the most comfortable person on set like, I feel great [Laughs]. So I was very lucky to have my superhero suit come later because I got to benefit. It‚Äôs like being the youngest child, like, you know, they figured it out. And then you‚Äôre hopefully less damage. Maybe MW-  Your castmate‚Äôs pain was your testing ground [laughs]. Last question before I let you go for everyone who‚Äôs so excited to finally see you in the costume and to see you as Guardian; what message do you have for the fans? AT-  Man, I hope that you enjoy the episode a lot of hard work went into making it. It‚Äôs incredibly personal. A lot of the words that [Kelly] says I wrote with the feelings that I have. It was very, very personal. I felt empowered stepping into being a superhero and I hope that a lot of our fans see themselves in that character and feel empowered. MW-  Congratulations again Azie and looking forward to seeing those sign pictures on Instagram or something so we can all see them. AT-  I‚Äôll start, I‚Äôll post all 400 shots [Laughs] MW-  Lots of slides, can‚Äôt wait. Thank you and all the best! AT-  You too Matt, take care! MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government Watch new episodes of  Supergirl  on The CW. Check your local listings for more information.

headline: Maryland Lawmakers: Don‚Äôt Send Prisoners On Home Confinement Back To Prison
summary: Maryland lawmakers are calling for federal officials to extend home confinement and compassionate release for prisoners who were let out as part of an effort to curb the spread of COVID-19 in correctional facilities.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî  Maryland lawmakers are calling for federal officials to extend home confinement and compassionate release for prisoners who were let out as part of an effort to curb the spread of COVID-19 in correctional facilities. In a  letter Friday to Attorney General Merrick Garland and U.S. Bureau of Prisons Director Michael Carvajal , the five lawmakers asked Garland to reconsider a legal opinion issued under the Trump administration that would send as many as 4,500 people back to prison once the COVID-19 emergency passes. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured ‚ÄúThese individuals were transferred from correctional facilities to home confinement to stem the spread of COVID-19 after the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) determined that they did not present a danger to the public, but a Department of Justice Office of Legal Counsel (OLC) opinion issued under the prior administration erroneously concludes that they will have to return to prison,‚Äù reads the letter signed by U.S. Sens. Ben Cardin and Chris Van Hollen and Reps. Kweisi Mfume, Dutch Ruppersberger and John Sarbanes. Correctional facilities and jails have been the source of outbreaks throughout the pandemic due to the large number of people living in close quarters, conditions that make it easy for contagious illnesses to spread. According to figures provided by the Bureau of Prisons,  more than 250 federal inmates and six BOP staffers have died of COVID-19 . The legal opinion issued by the Justice Department on Jan. 15 found the CARES Act gave the BOP the legal authority to release prisoners to home confinement during the COVID-19 pandemic but only while an emergency exists. Once the national emergency ends, the memo states, the BOP is required to bring those prisoners back into its custody. ‚ÄúThis OLC opinion incorrectly interprets the CARES Act, and we join Judiciary Committee Chairman (Sen. Dick Durbin) and Subcommittee on Criminal Justice and Counterterrorism Chairman (Sen. Cory Booker) in asking you to direct OLC to review and rescind the memo,‚Äù said the letter, citing the lack of risk the prisoners posed to the public and the cheaper costs resulting from home confinement. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn The letter pointed to the example of Ms. Gwen Levi, a 76-year-old Baltimore woman who served most of her 24.5-year sentence before being released to home confinement in June 2020. Levi was sent back to prison a year later due to a misunderstanding over halfway house rules because she did not answer her phone. Levi was later granted compassionate release despite the DOJ‚Äôs opposition. Levi recently described her experiences in an op-ed for  The Washington Post  in which she called for President Joe Biden to step in and keep 4,000 people on home confinement from going back to prison. ‚ÄúPresident Biden, please act now to keep these people home,‚Äù  Levi wrote in the July 15 op-ed . ‚ÄúThey are doing everything right, yet they wake up every day not knowing where they will be in a few months, and that uncertainty makes it impossible to plan for their futures. Please remove that cloud. Commute their sentences now.‚Äù Citing Levi‚Äôs story, the lawmakers asked the BOP and DOJ to support compassionate release and prevent the re-incarceration of those transferred to home confinement. They also echoed Levi‚Äôs request for the Biden administration to consider reducing prison sentences for or pardoning prisoners who have complied with the terms of their home confinement. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government ‚ÄúWe believe that these actions align with this administration‚Äôs stated support for reducing the incarcerated population in our country and for realigning our criminal justice system to focus on rehabilitation over punishment,‚Äù the lawmakers wrote. ‚ÄúThank you for your attention to this matter.‚Äù

headline: Towson High School Student Organizes Music Festival Fundraiser For The Chesapeake Bay Foundation
summary: A junior at Towson High School found a way to connect his two passions, music and the Chesapeake Bay, by organizing a free music festival in Baltimore that will double as a fundraiser for the Chesapeake Bay Foundation.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî  A Towson High School junior found a way to merge his two passions ‚Äî music and the Chesapeake Bay ‚Äî by organizing a free music festival in Baltimore to raise money for the Chesapeake Bay Foundation. The Tributary Festival is slated to run from 2 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. Sunday at the Baltimore Museum of Industry. The festival‚Äôs lineup includes various acts from the Lutherville School of Rock and four local bands: The Adirondacks,  Never Ending Fall , Impressions and  Modern Nomad . READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured Food trucks and interactive educational displays will accompany the live music, and the event is free of charge. Funds raised at the event will come from merchandise sales, donations and raffles. The Chesapeake Bay Foundation is an independent organization dedicated to protecting the Chesapeake Bay, the largest estuary in the United States. The organization works to remove the pollution from the bay and monitor its environmental health. Organizer Reed Spaulding explained on the festival‚Äôs website that he has a special connection with the bay. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn ‚ÄúMany of my fondest memories have been formed on the Chesapeake Bay and its rivers; be it fishing, crabbing, or boating with my grandparents on the Piankatank River in southern Virginia; tubing with my cousins on the Gunpowder in Baltimore County; attending Sandy Hill Camp on the Susquehanna; or sailing with the Downtown Sailing Club on the Inner Harbor,‚Äù Spaulding said. Spaulding is also on the lineup as a drummer in The Adirondacks band. For more information on the festival or  to donate , visit the  festival‚Äôs website. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government ¬†

headline: TikTok Under Fire Over ‚ÄòDevious Licks‚Äô Viral Challenge Inspiring Students To Vandalize School Bathrooms
summary: The challenge has spread widely, with many school districts reporting thousands of dollars in damage while issuing warnings to students and parents.
bodytext: HALEDON, N.J. (CBSNewYork)  ‚Äî A new, destructive TikTok craze has teens stealing and damaging property at schools. From stealing school supplies to trashing bathrooms, students around the country are jumping on a viral TikTok trend. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured Parents and teachers are quickly getting a crash course, too. ‚ÄúI was completely unaware of this phenomenon. But lo and behold, the very next day, we experienced a form of mild vandalism,‚Äù said Chris Wacha, superintendent of Haledon Public School. Wacha said a day after his son warned him about a challenge called ‚ÄúDevious Licks‚Äù last week, someone caused $400 in plumbing damage to the boys‚Äô bathroom. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not good. They need to shut this down. They need parents of the kids to come in and explain. This is a serious matter,‚Äù parent Florencio Hernandez said. ‚ÄúFor every action there is a reaction, so if you do something that‚Äôs not cool, then something not cool is going to happen to you,‚Äù parent Machanga Blackmon added. In Connecticut, some school administrators are taking drastic action, joining Sen. Richard Blumenthal at the state capitol Monday to demand TikTok ban users who have participated in the trend. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn ‚ÄúTheft and vandalism are glorified, literally. The viral videos depict as heroes the students who are stealing,‚Äù Blumenthal said. The social media site says it has already taken steps to shut down the trend by removing content. If you search the hashtag ‚ÄúDevious Licks,‚Äù a message appears saying ‚Äúno results found.‚Äù In Haledon, those responsible were disciplined. The superintendent said the key to preventing future vandalism lies within kids. ‚ÄúI want them to kind of go through the full decision-making process, and analyze and be an independent thinker,‚Äù Wacha said. The process starts with parents talking with their children. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government Blumenthal said, nationally, there have been over 94,000 of these viral videos over the last couple of months.

headline: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs Our Job‚Äô: Firefighters Rescue Passenger Suffering Medical Emergency On Southwest Flight
summary: Most firefighters have EMT or paramedic training, but it‚Äôs not often they have to use it at 30,000 feet.
bodytext: NORTH ATTLEBORO, Mass. (WBZ-TV) ‚Äì  Many of the calls firefighters go on are medical emergencies, where someone needs help. Most firefighters have EMT or paramedic training, but it‚Äôs not often they have to use it at 30,000 feet. ‚ÄúAs soon as we recognized there was a problem, our training kicked in,‚Äù said North Attleboro Fire Captain George McKinnon. ‚ÄúWe do this stuff all over the place in all different kinds of settings. I never thought I‚Äôd be doing it in an airplane up above.‚Äù READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured Last week, seven firefighters  from North Attleboro and Foxboro, Massachusetts were on a Southwest Airlines flight to Chicago. A nearby passenger was having a medical problem, then, he turned gray. The firefighters didn‚Äôt hesitate.   A group of North Attleboro and Foxboro firefighters saved a man‚Äôs life on a flight from Boston to Chicago (Image credit Heidi Poulin)   ‚ÄúWe did not even have to look at each other,‚Äù said North Attleboro Fire Chief Chris Coleman. ‚ÄúWe just simply knew what had to get done. Captain McKinnon did the CPR, I put the IV in, Captain Langille got the AED.‚Äù READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn The plane had all of the equipment the firefighters needed.¬†‚ÄúAfter the patient regained consciousness, we started an IV, we gave him some fluid and he remained conscious for the entire flight,‚Äù Chief Coleman said. The passenger had no pulse, it was that bad. But the firefighters got a pulse back, got his blood pressure up and heart going. The flight continued on to Chicago.¬†‚ÄúWe do it every day,‚Äù Chief Coleman said. ‚ÄúWhether it‚Äôs 30,000 feet in the air or on the sidewalk in North Attleboro. It‚Äôs our job.‚Äù The group was traveling to Denver to visit the Fallen Firefighters Memorial. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government The firefighters involved in the rescue were Chief Chris Coleman, Capt. George McKinnon, Capt. Josh Langille, Lt. Scott Langille, retired firefighters Jeff Badger and Rich McDonagh, and Foxborough Firefighter Cory Shepardson.

headline: University Of Maryland, Baltimore Police Department Names Next Chief
summary: The University of Maryland, Baltimore Police Department found its next police chief within its own ranks.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî  The University of Maryland, Baltimore Police Department found its next police chief within its own ranks. Thomas Leone, a six-year veteran of the agency who‚Äôs served as interim chief of police since June 2020, has been named the permanent chief of police, the university announced Tuesday. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured Leone, who holds a master‚Äôs degree and brings more than 20 years of experience from the Frederick County Sheriff‚Äôs Office, was selected for the department‚Äôs top role after a nationwide search. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm incredibly fortunate to work with a team of such committed, hard-working people. I‚Äôm honored to serve as their Chief and I don‚Äôt take that responsibility lightly. I‚Äôm committed to serving this community with integrity, equity, and accountability,‚Äù Chief Leone said of the news. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn Since Leone took charge of the police department, it has received dual accreditation for professional excellence in public safety. He has also expanded the department‚Äôs training program to cover topics such as implicit bias, pro-LGBTQ+ policing, mental health first aid, as well as guiding principals for use of force. In addition, Leone has formed committees with members of the UMB community with a focus on diversity, equity and inclusion. Among his other achievements as interim police chief are a 54.7-percent reduction in crime in 2020, the establishment of a body-worn camera program to improve transparency and the development of mentorship opportunities for security officers who are interested in becoming police. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government ‚ÄúWe are making wonderful progress, but this is just one step in a long journey,‚Äù Leone said. ‚ÄúI am committed to the communities we serve ‚Äì to building positive relationships ‚Äì and we will work every day to continue to learn and grow.‚Äù

headline: Man Shot In The Head, Killed In West Baltimore Tuesday
summary: Police responded to reports of a fatal shooting in the 5100 block of Wabash Avenue on Tuesday morning.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî¬† A man was shot in the head and killed in broad daylight in west Baltimore Tuesday morning, police said. Officers responded around 11:30 a.m. to the 5100 block of Wabash Avenue, where they found the man shot in the back of the head. Medics pronounced him dead at the scene. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured It‚Äôs the second time someone was shot in the head and killed in the city Tuesday. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn Officers responded around 2 a.m. to the 2500 block of Washington Avenue for a reported shooting, where they found a 27-year-old man shot in the head. Medics pronounced the victim dead on the scene. Anyone with information is urged to contact Baltimore Police Department¬† Homicide ¬†detectives at¬† 410-396-2100 . MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government Those who wish to remain anonymous can utilize the Metro Crime Stoppers tip line at 1-866-7LOCKUP. ¬†You can also submit an anonymous online text tip to Metro Crime Stoppers by visiting the MCS website.

headline: The 25 Best Horror Movies, Ranked
summary: A list of the most critically acclaimed scary films of all time -- and where to stream them right now.
bodytext: Halloween means Halloween movies ‚Äî and for some, Halloween movies most definitely means horror movies.   To help you make the most of the fall season, we‚Äôve put together a countdown of the 25 best horror movies of all time, from ‚Äú Psycho ‚Äù to ‚Äú A Quiet Place .‚Äù The list is based on¬† horror rankings from the movie-review aggregate site Metacritic .   Movies are ordered from good to excellent ‚Äî there are no bad horror movies on this list. Most ties were broken by looking at the total number of reviews that went into each film‚Äôs Metacritic score.   Overall, only movies with at least 15 Metacritic-tracked reviews are included in this countdown. We further narrowed the list to horror movies that can be streamed on subscription services, such as¬† Amazon Prime Video ¬†and¬† Paramount+ , or on free, ad-supported services, such as¬† Pluto TV ¬†and¬† Tubi .¬† (CBS Essentials, Paramount+ and Pluto are all subsidiaries of ViacomCBS.)¬†   Read on to see which films made the final cut ‚Äî and to find out where to stream all of them right now.   (Note: Metacritic scores and streaming availability are current as of publication; if a film is available to stream on multiple platforms, we‚Äôve listed up to two options.)    START YOUR AMAZON PRIME VIDEO FREE TRIAL     25. ‚ÄúA Quiet Place‚Äù (Metacritic score: 82)   PARAMOUNT PICTURES   Making good on its title, this 2018 film from writer-director-star¬† John Krasinski ¬†(‚ÄúThe Office‚Äù) rarely registered above a whisper en route to becoming a box-office smash.¬† Emily Blunt , Krasinski‚Äôs real-life wife, co-stars. Krasinski and Blunt play a married couple who must keep things hush-hush, lest their family becomes targeted by mysterious, sound-sensitive creatures.   In the Seattle Times, critic Moira Macdonald praised ‚Äú A Quiet Place ‚Äù as ‚Äú taut and often quite terrifying .‚Äù   Watch ‚ÄúA Quiet Place‚Äù on Paramount+ (subscription required)     24.‚ÄùUnder the Shadow‚Äù (Metacritic score: 83; 25 reviews)   VERTICAL ENTERTAINMENT US VIA YOUTUBE/SCREENSHOT   ‚Äú Under the Shadow ‚Äù is a 2016 Persian-language film set in wartorn Iran in the 1980s. The psychological chiller from writer-director Babak Anvari concerns a mother (played by Narges Rashidi), her daughter (played by Avin Manshadi) ‚Äî and the doll the mother says will protect them from a malevolent force.   ‚ÄúThe movie is first fascinating, then terrifying,‚Äù Noel Murray¬† wrote ¬†for the Los Angeles Times.   Watch ‚ÄúUnder the Shadow‚Äù on Netflix (subscription required)     23. ‚ÄúDrag Me to Hell‚Äù (2009) (Metacritic score: 83; 32 reviews)   SCREAM FACTORY   Released in 2009, in the wake of the financial collapse, Sam Raimi‚Äôs ‚Äú Drag Me to Hell ‚Äù tells the story of a loan officer (played by Alison Lohman) who is cursed after she denies a mortgage extension.   Salon‚Äôs Stephanie Zacharek found the film scary fun ‚Äî the result of ‚Äú an especially joyous kind of filmmaking .‚Äù   Watch ‚ÄúDrag Me to Hell‚Äù on Showtime (subscription required)   (CBS Essentials and Showtime are both subsidiaries of ViacomCBS.)     22. ‚ÄúSaint Maud‚Äù (Metacritic score: 83; 35 reviews)   A24   Released in 2021, ‚Äú Saint Maud ‚Äù is the newest film in this countdown. Morfydd Clark stars as a hospice nurse who‚Äôs out to save a soul.   According to the Atlantic‚Äôs David Sims, writer-director Rose Clark ‚Äú keep[s] the viewer guessing until the very last minute .‚Äù   Watch ‚ÄúSaint Maud‚Äù on Hulu (subscription required)   Watch ‚ÄúSaint Maud‚Äù on Paramount+ (subscription required)     21. ‚ÄúSweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street‚Äù (Metacritic score: 83; 39 reviews)   WARNER HOME VIDEO   Johnny Depp earned a Best Actor Oscar nomination as the vengeful barber at the bloody heart of this 2007 adaptation of the same-titled Broadway musical.   TV Guide Magazine‚Äôs Maitland McDonagh praised director Tim Burton for transforming the Stephen Sondheim source material into ‚Äú a cheerfully gothic morality tale .‚Äù   ‚ÄúSweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street‚Äù is the first ‚Äî but not last ‚Äî musical in this countdown.   Watch ‚ÄúSweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street‚Äù on Paramount+ (subscription required)   Watch ‚ÄúSweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street‚Äù on Pluto TV (free, with ads)     20. ‚ÄúThe Witch‚Äù (2016) (Metacritic score: 83; 46 reviews)   A24   Anya Taylor-Joy (‚ÄúThe Queen‚Äôs Gambit‚Äù) stars as a teen accused of being a witch in this 2016 film set in Puritan New England of the 1600s.   In Time Out, critic David Ehrlich¬† wrote ¬†that ‚Äú The Witch ‚Äù is ‚Äúone of the most genuinely unnerving horror films in recent memory‚Ä¶ ‚Äú   Watch ‚ÄúThe Witch‚Äù (2016) on Showtime (subscription required)     19. ‚ÄúThe Lighthouse‚Äù (Metacritic score: 83; 51 reviews)   A24   This black-and-white, 2019 entry is the second movie on this list from filmmaker Robert Eggers, who also wrote and directed ‚ÄúThe Witch.‚Äù   The psychological horror tale stars Robert Pattinson and Willem Dafoe as 19th-century lightkeepers who struggle with the isolation of their post.   ‚Äú‚Äò The Lighthouse ‚Äò stands as a monument to two titanic performances,‚Äù Tara Brady¬† praised ¬†in the Irish Times.   Watch ‚ÄúThe Lighthouse‚Äù on Amazon Prime Video (subscription required)   Watch ‚ÄúThe Lighthouse‚Äù on Tubi (free, with ads)     18. ‚ÄúDracula: Pages From a Virgin‚Äôs Diary‚Äù (Metacritic score: 84)   ENCORE+ VIA YOUTUBE/SCREENSHOT   If the horror genre teaches you anything, it‚Äôs to expect the unexpected. Enter ‚Äú Dracula: Pages From a Virgin‚Äôs Diary ,‚Äù the¬† second ¬†musical in this countdown of horror classics.   This 2003, black-and-white Canadian production looks and plays like a silent film (but with a score, natch). And that‚Äôs not the half of it: The Guy Maddin film recasts Bram Stoker‚Äôs vampire tale as a ballet.   ‚Äú‚Ä¶I hasten to add that this is the most inventive vampire picture of the last 80 years,‚Äù John Powers¬† wrote ¬†for the L.A. Weekly.   Watch ‚ÄúDracula: Pages From a Virgin‚Äôs Diary on Shudder‚Äù (subscription required)   Watch ‚ÄúDracula: Pages From a Virgin‚Äôs Diary‚Äù on Shudder on Encore+ YouTube channel ¬† (free)     17. ‚ÄúThe Host‚Äù (2007) (Metacritic score: 85)   SHOWBOX ENTERTAINMENT VIA AMAZON/SCREENSHOT   This film is the 2007 entry from Bong Joon Ho, the¬† Oscar-winning filmmaker of ‚ÄúParasite.‚Äù ¬†In ‚ÄúThe Host,‚Äù the Han River in Seoul, South Korea, is contaminated. Monster action ensues.   Entertainment Weekly‚Äôs Lisa Schwarzbaum called the film ‚Äúwildly entertaining.‚Äù   Viewer beware: Do not confuse this film with the 2013 Hollywood sci-fi film, also titled ‚ÄúThe Host.‚Äù   Watch ‚ÄúThe Host‚Äù (2007) on Amazon Prime Video (subscription required)   Watch ‚ÄúThe Host‚Äù (2007) on Hulu (subscription required)     16. ‚ÄúThe Babadook‚Äù (Metacritic score: 86)   SCREAM FACTORY   ‚Äú The Babadook ‚Äù is a 2014 Australian horror movie that finds a widowed mother (played by Essie Davis) and her young son (played by Noah Wiseman) terrorized by a character from a pop-up children‚Äôs book.   The Portland Oregonian‚Äôs Marc Mohan called the movie a ‚Äú near-masterpiece of unease .‚Äù   Watch ‚ÄúThe Babadook‚Äù on AMC+ (subscription required)     13 (TIE). ‚ÄúEraserhead‚Äù (Metacritic score: 87; 15 reviews)   LIBRA FILMS   This 1977 cult film marks the feature debut of writer-director David Lynch (‚ÄúTwin Peaks‚Äù). The avant-garde tale concerns a man (played by Jack Nance) and his space-alien-esque baby.   TV Guide Magazine¬† called ‚ÄúEraserhead‚Äù ¬†a ‚Äúcreepily sensuous film that suggests that the dark and troubling things we like to repress inhabit dresser drawers, live behind the radiator or lie under the bed.‚Äù   Watch ‚ÄúEraserhead‚Äù on HBO Max (subscription required)   Watch ‚ÄúEraserhead‚Äù on Criterion Channel (subscription required)     13 (TIE). ‚ÄúThe Invisible Man‚Äù (1933) (Metacritic score: 87; 15 reviews)   UNIVERSAL/GETTY IMAGES   This 1933 film, the original big-screen take on H.G. Wells‚Äô classic tale, is the first of three titles on this list that belongs to what is now known as the Universal Classic Monsters franchise.   Claude Rains stars in ‚Äú The Invisible Man ‚Äù as a scientist who gains the power of invisibility, but loses his mind.   ‚ÄúThe strangest character yet created by the screen‚Ä¶,‚Äù Variety¬† declared ¬†upon the film‚Äôs original release.   Watch ‚ÄúThe Invisible Man‚Äù (1933) on Shudder (subscription required)     13 (TIE). ‚ÄúThe Wicker Man‚Äù (1974) (Metacritic score: 87; 15 reviews)   ANCHOR BAY ENTERTAINMENT   Not to be confused with the¬† critically mocked Nicolas Cage remake , the original ‚ÄúWicker Man‚Äù was¬† praised by Variety  for a screenplay ‚Äúwhich, for sheer imagination and near-terror, has seldom been [equaled].‚Äù   Edward Woodward (‚ÄúThe Equalizer‚Äù) stars in the 1974 film as a police sergeant whose search for a missing girl takes him to a Scottish island, where the goings-on are, in a word, strange.   Watch ‚ÄúThe Wicker Man‚Äù (1974) on Amazon Prime Video (subscription required)     11 (TIE). ‚ÄúJaws‚Äù (Metacritic score: 87; 21 reviews)   UNIVERSAL/GETTY IMAGES   Steven Spielberg turbo-charged his directing career, helped create the modern movie blockbuster ‚Äî and put a scare in beachgoers with his blood-soaked 1975 adaptation of the same-titled novel about a killer shark. Roy Scheider, Richard Dreyfuss and Robert Shaw star in the Oscar-winning film.   ‚ÄúThis is a suspense classic that leaves teeth-marks,‚Äù the Guardian‚Äôs Peter Bradshaw¬† wrote ¬†in praise of ‚Äú Jaws .‚Äù   Watch ‚ÄúJaws‚Äù on Amazon Prime Video (subscription required)     11 (TIE). ‚ÄúHalloween‚Äù (1978) (Metacritic score: 87¬† 21 reviews)   COMPASS INTERNATIONAL PICTURES/SUNSET BOULEVARD/CORBIS/GETTY IMAGES   The knife-wielding, mask-wearing horror villain Michael Myers debuted in filmmaker John Carpenter‚Äôs original ‚Äú Halloween .‚Äù The influential slasher film stars Jamie Lee Curtis as the terrorized Laurie Strode, a character Curtis would reprise for several sequels and remakes.   According to critics, the first ‚ÄúHalloween‚Äù is the best ‚ÄúHalloween.‚Äù Film Threat‚Äôs David Grove¬† called ¬†the 1978 release ‚Äú[a]rguably, the greatest horror film of the past thirty years.‚Äù   Watch ‚ÄúHalloween‚Äù (1978) on Shudder (subscription required)   Watch ‚ÄúHalloween‚Äù (1978) on Redbox (free, with ads)     10. ‚ÄúHereditary‚Äù (Metacritic score: 87; 45 reviews)   LIONSGATE HOME ENTERTAINMENT   This 2018 film is the newest release in our countdown‚Äôs Top 10. ‚Äú Hereditary ‚Äù features Milly Shapiro as agirl whose family is menaced by the demon-summoning handiwork of a late matriarch.   The Verge‚Äôs Tasha Robinson¬† hailed the film ¬†as ‚Äúa hell of an intense ride, made for a crowd that enjoys heart-clutching adrenaline spikes.‚Äù   Watch ‚ÄúHereditary‚Äù on Showtime (subscription required)     9. ‚ÄúThe Innocents‚Äù (Metacritic score: 88)   SILVER SCREEN COLLECTION/GETTY IMAGES   This entry stars six-time Oscar nominee Deborah Kerr, features a screenplay co-written by Truman Capote (‚ÄúIn Cold Blood‚Äù) and shares DNA with Henry James‚Äô ‚ÄúThe Turn of the Screw.‚Äù But here‚Äôs what horror fans really need to know: Per the Los Angeles Times‚Äô Susan King, ‚Äú The Innocents ‚Äù is ‚Äú [o]ne of the scariest films ever made .‚Äù   The 1961 movie casts Kerr as a governess who comes to believe the house she works in is haunted ‚Äî and the children in her care, possessed.   Watch ‚ÄúThe Innocents‚Äù on Criterion Channel (subscription required)     8. ‚ÄúNight of the Living Dead‚Äù (1968) (Metacritic score: 89)   PICTORIAL PARADE/GETTY IMAGES   George A. Romero deployed a reported $114,000 budget, a no-name cast and Pittsburgh-area locations to create a groundbreaking, 1968 zombie tale that New Yorker critic Pauline Kael hailed as ‚Äú one of the most gruesomely terrifying movies ever made .‚Äù   An independent production that fell into the public domain, ‚ÄúNight of the Living Dead‚Äù is available to stream on almost every platform out there, including subscription services such as¬† HBO Max ¬†and¬† Shudder . Below, we have spotlighted two of the free, ad-supported services where you can watch the horror classic right now.   Watch ‚ÄúNight of the Living Dead‚Äù on Pluto TV (free, with ads)   Watch ‚ÄúNight of the Living Dead‚Äù on Tubi (free, with ads)     7. ‚ÄúThe Birds‚Äù (Metacritic score: 90)   FILMPUBLICITYARCHIVE/UNITED ARCHIVES/GETTY IMAGES   A bunch of birds are out to get a socialite (played by Tippi Hedren) and almost every other resident in Bodega Bay in this perennially popular 1963 film, the first of two Alfred Hitchcock entries in our countdown.   ‚ÄúClamps itself to your recollection and doesn‚Äôt let go,‚Äù Empire‚Äôs Angie Errigo¬† wrote ¬†of ‚Äú The Birds .‚Äù   Watch ‚ÄúThe Birds‚Äù on Showtime (subscription required)     6. ‚ÄúFrankenstein‚Äù (1931) (Metacritic score: 91)   BETTMANN/GETTY IMAGES   Though released nearly 90 years ago, this 1931 Universal Classic Monsters entry continues to chill ‚Äî and to be praised by critics more than any subsequent Frankenstein movie.   Boris Karloff stars as the monstrous and misunderstood creation of the corpse-stealing Henry Frankenstein (played by Colin Clive).   ‚ÄúBeautiful photography, a heartbreaking story, and iconic moments from beginning to end,‚Äù Empire‚Äôs Kim Newman¬† wrote ¬†of 1931‚Äôs ‚Äú Frankenstein .‚Äù ‚ÄúAbsolutely unmissable.‚Äù   Watch ‚ÄúFrankenstein‚Äù (1931) on Vix (free, with ads)   (Note: Vix is a Spanish-language streaming service, but ‚ÄúFrankenstein‚Äù is presented in its original, English-language form.)     5. ‚ÄúInvasion of the Body Snatchers‚Äù (1956) (Metacritic score: 92)   ALLIED ARTISTS/GETTY IMAGES   The paranoia runs high in this sci-fi/horror classic directed by Don Siegel (‚ÄúDirty Harry‚Äù) and starring Kevin McCarthy, Dana Wynter and Carolyn Jones (‚ÄúThe Addams Family‚Äù).   The first of several big-screen adaptations of the novel ‚ÄúThe Body Snatchers,‚Äù the 1956 film is the best of the lot, per the critical consensus.   ‚ÄúIncredibly chilling, this Don Siegel movie still delivers a powerful punch,‚Äù the Chicago Tribune‚Äôs David McDonnell¬† wrote of ‚ÄúInvasion of the Body Snatchers.‚Äù   Watch ‚ÄúInvasion of the Body Snatchers‚Äù on Paramount+ (subscription required)   Watch ‚ÄúInvasion of the Body Snatchers‚Äù on Pluto TV (free, with ads)     4. ‚ÄúThe Bride of Frankenstein (Metacritic score: 95)   JOHN KOBAL FOUNDATION/GETTY IMAGES   This is the third and highest-ranked Universal Classic Monsters film in this countdown ‚Äî all directed by James Whale.   A 1935 sequel to Whale‚Äôs ‚ÄúFrankenstein,‚Äù ‚Äú Bride of Frankenstein ‚Äù stars Elsa Lanchester as the made-to-order mate of Boris Karloff‚Äôs monster. Lanchester also plays author Mary Shelley in the film‚Äôs stage-setting prologue.   ‚Äú‚ÄòBride‚Äô is a wild ride, even today,‚Äù Phelim O‚ÄôNeill¬† praised ¬†in the Guardian. ‚ÄúIt flits between the classical and the gutter, the camp and the serious in a manner that‚Äôs hard to pin down.‚Äù   Watch ‚ÄúThe Bride of Frankenstein‚Äù on Shudder (subscription required)     3. ‚ÄúRosemary‚Äôs Baby‚Äù (Metacritic score: 96; 15 reviews)   CBS/GETTY IMAGES   In this 1968 Roman Polanski film, Mia Farrow stars as a woman who‚Äôs impregnated with Satan‚Äôs spawn after she and her actor husband (played by John Cassavetes) move into an imposing Manhattan apartment building. Ruth Gordon won an Oscar for her role as a neighbor who‚Äôs a lot more than just nosy.   ‚ÄúThe tension created is practically unbearable,‚Äù the New York Daily News‚Äô Kathleen Carroll¬† wrote of ‚ÄúRosemary‚Äôs Baby.‚Äù   Watch ‚ÄúRosemary‚Äôs Baby‚Äù on Starz (subscription required)     2. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt Look Now‚Äù (Metacritic score: 96; 25 reviews)   PARAMOUNT PICTURES   ‚Äú Don‚Äôt Look Now ‚Äù is a 1973 film starring Donald Sutherland and Julie Christie as a married couple who travel to Venice, Italy, for the husband‚Äôs work ‚Äî and for a change of scenery following their young daughter‚Äôs death. But the two find they can‚Äôt escape their grief ‚Äî or their fates.   ‚ÄúA haunting, beautiful labyrinth that gets inside your bones and stays there,‚Äù Edward Guthmann wrote for the San Francisco Chronicle.   Watch ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt Look Now‚Äù on Pluto TV (free, with ads)     1. ‚ÄúPsycho‚Äù (1960) (Metacritic score: 97)   FILMPUBLICITYARCHIVE/UNITED ARCHIVES/GETTY IMAGES   The greatest horror movie of all time? According to critics, the answer is ‚ÄúPsycho.‚Äù   ‚Äú‚Äò Psycho ‚Äò should be seen at least three times by any discerning film-goer,‚Äù the Village Voice‚Äôs Andrew Sarris¬† wrote , ‚Äúthe first time for the sheer terror of the experience‚Ä¶‚Äù   The 1960 Alfred Hitchcock movie stars Anthony Perkins as a motel proprietor by the name of Norman Bates ‚Äî a man who can‚Äôt be trusted to behave when the shower water is running.   Watch ‚ÄúPsycho‚Äù on Showtime (subscription required)     Related content from CBS Essentials     What‚Äôs new on Amazon Prime Video in September 2021   What‚Äôs new on Paramount+ in September 2021   The best-selling Sony PlayStation 5 games right now   Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs new on Paramount+ this month   How to watch football games on NFL Game Pass

headline: Baltimore County Public Library Hires Full-Time Social Worker
summary: The Baltimore County Public Library is adding a full-time social worker to its staff as part of an effort to better meet the community's needs.
bodytext: TOWSON, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  The Baltimore County Public Library is adding a full-time social worker to its staff as part of an effort to better meet the community‚Äôs needs. Starting on Oct. 1, the social worker will be available to visitors in need for one-on-one advice free of charge, as well as to put them in touch with a wide range of resources depending on their situation. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured This social worker will keep office hours at six of the library‚Äôs 19 branches including the Essex, North Point, Perry Hall, Rosedale, Sollers Point and White Marsh locations. Syeira Anthony‚Äôs goal is to form relationships with county residents who need help, whether that means getting access to public assistance or mental health counseling. ‚ÄúMy vision as the first social worker at Baltimore County Public Library is to erase some of the stigma associated with seeking help,‚Äù Anthony said. ‚ÄúDue to the welcoming nature of the library, it is the perfect place for someone in my profession to help people in the community feel connected and empowered.‚Äù READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn Below are some of the resources Anthony will be able to assist residents with:   Access to public assistance   Domestic violence help   Grief and loss support   LGBTQIA+ support   Mental health counseling   Parenting resources   Senior resources and aid   Substance abuse   Youth services   The hire of a full-time social worker was made possible through the support of the Osprey Foundation of Towson. Over the next two years, the goal is to expand the program to hire two more full-time social workers who will be available to assist visitors in other parts of Baltimore County. ‚ÄúWe constantly strive to meet the needs of the community,‚Äù Baltimore County Public Library Director Sonia Alc√°ntara-Antoine said. ‚ÄúEmploying a full-time social worker in the library is yet another way to connect the county‚Äôs most vulnerable with critical‚Äìand possibly life-saving‚Äìresources.‚Äù MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government Residents who need assistance can either visit with Anthony at one of the above branches during her office hours. They can also schedule an appointment in advance  via email  or by calling 443-862-9348.

headline: Jo Lasorda, Wife Of Late Los Angeles Dodgers Manager Tommy Lasodra, Dies At 91
summary: Jo Lasorda passed away eight months after her husband and former Los Angeles Dodgers manager Tommy Lasorda died in January.
bodytext: LOS ANGELES (CBSLA)  ‚Äì The widow of Dodgers legendary manager Tommy Lasorda has passed away at the age of 91.   An undated photograph of Tommy and Jo Lasorda. (Credit: Dodgers)   The team confirmed Tuesday that Jo Lasorda died Monday evening at the couple‚Äôs longtime Fullerton home. There was no immediate word on a cause of death.   ‚ÄúShe was surrounded by her loved ones at her home,‚Äù the team wrote in a statement.   The couple were married for 70 years. Tommy Lasorda  passed away in January  at the age of 93 after suffering a heart attack.   Jo Lasorda was born Joan Miller in Greenville, South Carolina, on March 14, 1930. She met Tommy Lasorda at a Greenville Spinners minor league baseball game, where he was a pitcher. The two were married on April 14, 1950.   Jo Lasorda is survived by her daughter, granddaughter and sister.   Tommy Lasorda, one of the most iconic figures in baseball history, managed the Dodgers for 21 seasons from 1976 to 1996. He won two World Series titles in 1981 and 1988.   FILE ‚Äî Tommy and Jo Lasorda attend a baseball game between the Colorado Rockies and the Dodgers at Dodger Stadium on Sept. 22, 2016. (Getty Images)   The city of Fullerton, meanwhile, where the couple resided for the better part of seven decades, had  previously announced that it will honor  Tommy Lasorda Wednesday, on what would have been his 94th birthday, with Tommy Lasorda Day.   The couple lived in Fullerton for 68 years.

headline: A Closer Look At 4 Drugs Used To Treat COVID-19; What Really Works?
summary: At the beginning of the pandemic, doctors tried everything they could to save lives, including some treatments that are now proven not as effective as once thought.
bodytext: DALLAS (CBSDFW.COM) ‚Äì  Hydroxychloroquine, remdesivir, ivermectin and monoclonal antibodies are some of the most-talked about drugs when it comes to COVID-19. But which treatments are best when it comes to fighting the coronavirus? KTVT-TV in Dallas went to Dr. Robert Gottlieb with Baylor Scott & White Research Institute to learn more about each. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured ‚ÄúThere are many therapies that work on paper, or even in the laboratory that don‚Äôt work when you bring them to a human.‚Äù said Dr. Gottlieb. ‚ÄúWe have to remember that we‚Äôre not trying to treat a virus in a test tube, we‚Äôre trying to treat a virus in a human being.‚Äù At the beginning of the pandemic, doctors tried everything they could to save lives, including some treatments that are now proven not as effective as once thought. With more research, doctors now better understand which ones actually work, and have the science and data to back it up. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve clearly studied hydroxychloroquine,‚Äù said Dr. Gottlieb. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve shown that promise is a false promise, that is one of the best study things in the world, and it just doesn‚Äôt help for the virus.‚Äù Hydroxychloroquine is an antimalarial drug also used to treat conditions such as rheumatoid arthritis and lupus. Early studies showed promise in a laboratory setting, and doctors thought the drug could help keep people‚Äôs immune systems from overreacting, but Gottlieb said peer reviewed studies found that it does not benefit patients hospitalized with COVID-19. ‚ÄúWe can draw a very complex pathway of why it should work, but we can‚Äôt will it into existence as an effective therapy. The data is the data,‚Äù he explained. A second treatment showing promise, at least for severe cases of COVID, is the antiviral drug remdesivir.¬†‚ÄúRemdesivir decreases duration of hospitalization, regardless of oxygen support level required in the hospital. It actually saves lives,‚Äù said Gottlieb. The drug received full FDA approval last October for use in adult and pediatric COVID patients 12 and older requiring hospitalization. It‚Äôs still being studied for outpatient use. Another potential treatment that‚Äôs receiving a lot of attention is ivermectin. It is FDA-approved to treat certain parasitic worms, head lice and skin conditions like Rosacea. It also has shown some antiviral properties, but the jury is still out on whether it can be used as an effective treatment for COVID-19. Clinical trials are underway, but Gottlieb said it‚Äôs just too early to know if it‚Äôs helpful. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn ‚ÄúWe haven‚Äôt completely disproved it, but we have no evidence at the moment of efficacy,‚Äù Gottlieb said. ‚ÄúSo right now, we don‚Äôt know that answer. There‚Äôs no recommendation for it. I personally do not prescribe it.‚Äù Human-grade ivermectin requires a prescription, but it also a drug that‚Äôs used for animals. Because of its popularity on blogs and social media, there were reports of people raiding feed stores to buy the animal-grade version. Gottlieb said that is dangerous and could keep someone from getting a treatment that is proven to work. ‚ÄúIf someone thinks that they‚Äôre being protected by ivermectin and they‚Äôre not, you‚Äôre really just prescribing them a version of a placebo and losing the opportunity to actually get treated with an effective therapy,‚Äù Gottlieb said. ‚ÄúFrom that standpoint, it really is harmful, because it gives the illusion of protection.‚Äù The most promising treatment at the moment in an outpatient setting is monoclonal antibody therapy. ‚ÄúIf you have one or more mild symptoms, it doesn‚Äôt matter how mild they are, those are the patients we studied, and we showed that we could prevent 70 to 87% of those patients from being hospitalized,‚Äù said Gottlieb. ‚ÄúWe could actually save lives, if used early.‚Äù Gottlieb said there‚Äôs three different manufacturers, and there‚Äôs no comparative efficacy data. He said the one that‚Äôs on the shelf in your healthcare system is the appropriate one. Various centers have opened all across Texas to provide the therapy free of charge. The doctor said outside of clinical trials, it‚Äôs important to stick with what we know will work. ‚ÄúEven as I conducted the research, I was really convinced that  therapy X  or  therapy y  would really work,‚Äù Dr. Gottlieb explained. ‚ÄúWhen we‚Äôve actually wrapped up the study and actually determine who‚Äôs who, I‚Äôve been very humbled by that answer.‚Äù Another type of medication Gottlieb said is proving helpful, and is also cheap and readily available: corticosteroids. They‚Äôve been shown to be beneficial for hospitalized patients needing oxygen, but can actual be harmful for those who are not in that situation. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government Gottlieb said the best defense is to get the vaccine. He also said there‚Äôs nothing wrong with taking vitamins D and C or a multivitamin. He said while they may not really have an effect on the virus, there‚Äôs really now downside and they can make you feel more positive. That mentality by itself is powerful.

headline: Jessup Man Arrested On Five Counts Of Child Pornography
summary: Troopers arrested a Howard County man Tuesday morning after evidence of distribution and possession of child pornography.
bodytext: JESSUP, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  Troopers arrested a Howard County man Tuesday morning after evidence of distribution and possession of child pornography. 55-year-old Paulo Sousa Lacerda was the suspect identified by the Maryland State Police Internet Crimes Against Children Task Force. He is charged with five counts of possession of child pornography and three counts of distribution of child pornography. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured He‚Äôs being held without bond at the Howard County Detention Center. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn After a search warrant was served for Lacerda‚Äôs house, officers found multiple pornography files on his electronic devices. He was arrested at the scene. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government The Maryland State Police Computer Crimes Unit coordinates the Maryland Internet Crimes Against Children Task Force. Taskforce investigators focus on identifying those involved in child pornography via the Internet and other related crimes that victimize children.

headline: 25-Year-Old Pennsylvania Man Sentenced To Six Years In Federal Prison For Selling Methamphetamine In Cecil County
summary: A Pennsylvania man was sentenced to six years in federal prison followed by five years of supervised release for possession with intent to distribute approximately 211 grams of methamphetamine in Cecil County.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî  A Pennsylvania man was sentenced to six years in federal prison followed by five years of supervised release for possession with intent to distribute approximately 211 grams of methamphetamine in Cecil County. According to his plea, during the fall of 2019 officials learned Nakir Ali Kiett, who was known as ‚ÄúOmar,‚Äù was selling methamphetamine in Cecil County. In Aug. of 2019, an informant introduced an officer to Kiett. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured Officials said between Aug. 28 and Sept. 30, 2019, the undercover officer arranged and conducted five separate controlled purchases of methamphetamine from Kiett, totaling approximately 150 grams. On Oct. 9, 2019, investigators obtained a search warrant for Kiett‚Äôs vehicle. The following day, investigators arranged for a controlled purchase of methamphetamine from him. Once he arrived at the location, investigators detained him and searched him along with his vehicle. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn During the search, investigators recovered approximately 61 grams of methamphetamine located in a space behind the vehicle‚Äôs radio. In total, approximately 211 grams of methamphetamine were purchased or seized from Kiett between Aug. 2019 and Oct. 2019. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government Kiett agreed and admitted that he knowingly and intentionally possessed the above-referenced methamphetamine with the intent to distribute it.

headline: Two BCPS Students & Two Recent Graduates Appointed To Serve On Maryland Youth Advisory Council
summary: Two Baltimore County Public Schools students along with two recent graduates were appointed to serve on Maryland's Youth Advisory Council, officials announced.
bodytext: TOWSON, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  Two Baltimore County Public Schools students along with two recent graduates were appointed to serve on Maryland‚Äôs Youth Advisory Council, officials announced. ‚ÄúAs members of the council, our students and recent graduates will make legislative recommendations on issues affecting their peers, promote youth policy issues, and serve as liaisons between Maryland‚Äôs youth and Maryland‚Äôs policymakers,‚Äù said BCPS Superintendent Dr. Darryl L. Williams. ‚ÄúBCPS has a proud legacy of developing student leaders, and we are pleased that BCPS and its students will be so well-represented as the council does its work.‚Äù READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured Ricky Bridges, a junior at Franklin High School, Maja Durkovic, a junior at Eastern Technical High School, Meghna Chandrasekaran, a 2021 graduate of Western School of Technology and Rosalind Marfo of Reisterstown, a 2021 graduate of Franklin High School and a freshman at the University of Maryland, College Park will all serve one-year terms on the council. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn This will be the first year on the council for Chandrasekaran and Durkovic and the second year for Bridges and Marfo. A total of 23 high school and college students from ten Maryland counties will serve on the council. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government ¬†

headline: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs Terrible‚Äô: Frustrated Parents In Anne Arundel County React To School Bus Driver Shortages, Officials Say They Are Working To Resolve Problem
summary: Families in Anne Arundel County are feeling what is being called a nationwide school bus driver shortage and some say the shortage is being exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic.
bodytext: ANNAPOLIS, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  Families in Anne Arundel County are feeling what is being called a nationwide school bus driver shortage. Some say the shortage is being exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic. Tuesday, dozens of families were impacted because of the shortage. READ MORE:  School Bus Driver Shortage Continues To Impact Maryland Anne Arundel County Executive Steuart Pittman is calling the issue a crisis and said county buses in Annapolis are now offering to transport students to school for free. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre into the first month and here we are starting it out like this, it‚Äôs terrible,‚Äù said Ryan Brooks, parent of AACPS student. It‚Äôs an ongoing problem continuing to affect families. ‚ÄúI got an email saying that bus routes are going to be shorted because we‚Äôre short bus drivers,‚Äù said Brooks. School districts are in desperate need of bus drivers. ‚ÄúIt is a market issue, a labor market issue and we need to get more people driving buses, get them trained, get them hired,‚Äù said Pittman. In Anne Arundel County, some parents report their children have been left stranded at bus stops due to no drivers showing up. ‚ÄúSo they get marked absent, they get punished for it and it‚Äôs not their fault,‚Äù said Brooks. READ MORE:  Amid Driver Shortage, Maryland To Expedite Driving Tests & Credentials For School Bus Drivers Brooks said he wouldn‚Äôt put his daughter on school transportation because of that reason. ‚ÄúHow do you work a full-time job in the morning, make sure your kids might get on the bus, might not and get them fully attended?‚Äù said Brooks. ‚ÄúIf they have to work seven to three and make sure their child is at school at 7 o‚Äôclock also, and what if you only have one car and you have two parents?‚Äù According to Anne Arundel County Public Schools website, about 24 bus routes were impacted Tuesday, with more than half without service and the rest showing delays. ‚ÄúParticularly in the Annapolis cluster where one company is having the most problems, one of our contractors is having the most problems hiring staff and keeping them on to drive those buses,‚Äù said Pittman. County and school officials said they‚Äôre working to fix the problem. ‚ÄúI will be meeting with the contractors myself asking the question, what will it take to get them the incentives, any bonuses they need to be able to hire the drivers they need, we‚Äôre expediting that,‚Äù said Pittman. It‚Äôs not just in Anne Arundel County, Howard, Harford, and Baltimore Counties along with Baltimore City are also dealing with a shortage of bus drivers. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what they plan on doing but if they don‚Äôt plan on doing it and doing it right soon, it‚Äôs going to cause an uproar somewhere,‚Äù said Brooks. Governor Hogan is now calling on state agencies to expedite the licensing process for anyone who wants to be a school bus driver. MORE NEWS:  Anne Arundel County Executive Releases Statement In Regards To School Bus Driver Shortages This weekend, on Saturday, Sept. 25, MDOT MVA will host a ‚ÄúBus Drivers‚Äô Day‚Äù at select  MVA locations  to take steps to make sure school bus drivers are able to obtain proper testing and credentials as quickly as possible in order to help meet the needs of school systems across the state.

headline: WATCH: ‚ÄòFBI,‚Äô ‚ÄòFBI: Most Wanted‚Äô And ‚ÄòFBI: International‚Äô Premiere Tonight In A Special 3-Part Crossover Event
summary: The Feds are back tonight with a three-part crossover event for 'FBI,' 'FBI: Most Wanted' and 'FBI: International.'
bodytext: (CBS) ‚Äì  The Feds are back tonight with a three-part crossover event for  FBI, FBI: Most Wanted  and  FBI: International.¬† The action kicks off tonight at 8:00PM on CBS, or streaming with the CBS App and  Paramount+ , with  FBI  in an episode titled ‚ÄúAll That Glitters.‚Äù Next up will be  FBI: Most Wanted  at 9:00PM with ‚ÄúExposed‚Äù and finally the series premiere of  FBI: International  at 10:00PM. Check below for a preview of all three crossover episodes and be sure to tune in tonight starting at 8:00PM for a triple dose of  FBI , only on CBS. Check your local listings for more information. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured ‚ÄúAll That Glitters‚Äù ¬†‚Äì  After a young woman is killed on her way home from a lavish yacht party, the team investigates who she was and how she came to be at the event, which was attended by some of the most influential people in the world. Also, Maggie brings Crosby (Kellan Lutz,  FBI: Most Wanted ) into the investigation after a murder suspect is identified as a veteran who had been on several Army operations with Crosby. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn ‚ÄúExposed‚Äù ¬†‚Äì¬† A local FBI case involving two murdered women and a sea of powerful men turns into a manhunt for the dangerous leader of a far-reaching criminal enterprise, in the second part of a special three-part crossover event and the third season premiere of  FBI: Most Wanted  at a special time, Tuesday, September 21st from 9:00-10:00 PM, ET/PT. OA (Zeeko Zaki,  FBI ) assists Jess and the team, joined by special agent Kristin Gaines (Alexa Davalos,  FBI: Most Wanted ). MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government ‚ÄúPilot‚Äù ‚Äì ¬† Special Agent Scott Forrester and his Budapest-based FBI fly team head to Croatia, after Isobel Castille (Alana De La Garza,  FBI ) enlists their help to capture an American fugitive who escaped to Zagreb with a 14-year-old girl. OA (Zeeko Zaki,  FBI ) continues with the mission overseas, intent on bringing the fugitive to justice, while Europol agent Katrin Jaeger attempts to help the team secure the necessary support and access from the less-than-cooperative local authorities, in the conclusion of a special three-part crossover event, and the series premiere of  FBI: International , at a special time, Tuesday, September 21st from 10:00-11:00 PM, ET/PT.  FBI: International  moves to its regular 9:00-10:00 PM, ET/PT time slot on Tuesday, September 28th.

headline: Baltimore Man Charged For Shooting Two Men After Crash

bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî  A 50-year-old man is charged with two counts of attempted first-degree murder after shooting two men in central Baltimore early Sunday morning. headline: ‚ÄòI Know They Need A Lot Of Help‚Äô: USPS Hosts Job Fair In Westminster Tuesday
summary: The post office is now working to build a more stable workforce after months of frustrating mail delays.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî  The post office is now working to build a more stable workforce after months of frustrating mail delays. ‚ÄúComing here a lot, I know that they need a lot of help,‚Äù said Chris Zimmerman, a Westminster resident who is applying for some of the open positions. READ MORE:  'It's A Mess, I Feel Angry' Ongoing USPS Mail Delays Leaves Residents Frustrated In Baltimore County USPS has been recently been hosting several job fairs at its locations across the Baltimore region to fill many of the open positions. Postal officials tell WJZ that they are expecting to hire about 100,000 employees nationwide through Jan. 2022, including 40,000 for its peak holiday season. READ MORE:  USPS Mail Delays Continue Across Baltimore Area; Rep. Dutch Ruppersberger Says He Working Closely With Local Postmaster To Find Solution Marylanders have experienced both delayed and sporadic mail service throughout the pandemic, causing packages and letters to be late. Some of those attending the Westminster job fair on Tuesday said they are hoping that they can help improve the service. ‚ÄúThe postal service is an intricate part of everyday life. They help you do what you need to do and basically that‚Äôs what I want to do is help,‚Äù said Bethany Szczesny, USPS applicant. headline: Two Men Seriously Injured Following Balcony Collapse In Montgomery County
summary: Two men were hospitalized with life-threatening injuries after a fall from a second-story balcony at a Maryland home, authorities said.
bodytext: CLARKSBURG, Md. (AP) ‚Äî  Two men were hospitalized with life-threatening injuries after a fall from a second-story balcony at a Maryland home, authorities said. Montgomery County Fire and Rescue spokesperson Jason Blake said the men fell at a Clarksburg home on Monday morning, taking a section of railing with them to the ground, WUSA-TV reported. One man was flown to a trauma center and the other was taken in an ambulance. headline: Kunta Kinte Festival Returns After Year-Long Hiatus

bodytext: ANNAPOLIS, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî¬† The Kunta Kinte Heritage Festival will return to City Dock this weekend for its 31st year. The festival celebrating the perseverance, education and cultural heritage of Africans, African Americans and Caribbean people of African descent is coming back after a year-long hiatus in light of the pandemic. headline: Baltimore County Couple Sues Police Department After Traumatizing Encounter
summary: On April 8, 2021, James Como and Wanda Redd attended a family gathering in the Overlea neighborhood of Baltimore County.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî¬†  On April 8, James Como and Wanda Redd attended a family gathering in the Overlea neighborhood of Baltimore County.   As the couple walked to their car, they were stopped by two police officers in the parking lot.     According to Baltimore County Police, they were called to the area at around 1:45 a.m. for reports of a public disturbance and reports of a couple fighting.     ‚ÄúWe weren‚Äôt fighting, I didn‚Äôt have no bruises, he didn‚Äôt have no bruises, he didn‚Äôt have anything, nothing was wrong with us,‚Äù said Wanda Redd in an interview with WJZ Tuesday.     The officers questioned Redd and Como and left. The couple said they then got into their car and roughly¬†ten minutes later, police came back, this time with another officer.     ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs when I decided to pull my phone out and started recording, cuz I didn‚Äôt like the energy,‚Äù said Como.     In the video, you can hear one officer asking Wanda to see her ID.     ‚ÄúFor what?‚Äù Wanda replied.     According to Baltimore County Police, police received a second call. Wanda tells the officers, ‚ÄúWe not doing anything, sir.‚Äù     Then, Como claims, officers went ‚Äúinto attack mode.‚Äù     Attorney Governor E. Jackson, III, who represents Redd and Como, said it‚Äôs at this point his clients‚Äô rights begin to get violated ‚Äúand quite frankly it snowballed from there.‚Äù     In the video, an one officer can be seen reaching his arm inside Redd‚Äôs window and, she pulls his hand away, she claims he hit her.     ‚ÄúStop, look he‚Äôs hit me,‚Äù Redd said.     Moments later, another officer breaks open the window on Como‚Äôs side.     ‚ÄúFrom that moment, I thought I was gonna die,‚Äù said Redd.     Police arrested Redd and Como.     According to charging documents, Como was charged with assaulting Redd, and Redd was charged with failing to obey and disturbing the peace.     ‚ÄúI feel humiliated. Like I asked over and over, ‚Äòwhat did I do? Like, what did I do?‚Äô‚Ä¶ the police officers, they‚Äôre supposed to be here to help and serve us. Why am I being hit on?‚Äù Redd asked.     ‚ÄúThere was no requirement for them to produce identification when they‚Äôre not engaged in any illegal activity,‚Äù Jackson, the couple‚Äôs attorney, added.     Now, the couple is suing the three police officers who surrounded their car that night, and their sergeant, for $25 million in damages, ‚Äúbecause of the reckless malicious nature of the officers who we have sued individually and in their official capacity,‚Äù Jackson said.     The Baltimore County Police Department tells WJZ this incident remains under administrative review and the arrests have been reviewed by the State‚Äôs Attorney‚Äôs Office.

headline: Realmuto‚Äôs Two-Run Triple In 10th Leads Phillies Past Orioles 3-2
summary: J.T. Realmuto hit a two-run triple with two outs in the 10th inning to rally the Philadelphia Phillies past the Baltimore Orioles 3-2 on Tuesday night for a boost to their longshot playoff odds.
bodytext: PHILADELPHIA (AP) ‚Äî  J.T. Realmuto hit a two-run triple with two outs in the 10th inning to rally the Philadelphia Phillies past the Baltimore Orioles 3-2 on Tuesday night for a boost to their longshot playoff odds. Realmuto lined a shot to right field past the outstretched glove of Anthony Santander, and NL MVP candidate Bryce Harper, who was intentionally walked, scored the winner and set off a wild celebration in the infield. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured Down 2-1 and with an automatic runner on third, Orioles righty Cesar Valdez (2-2) intentionally walked Harper. Realmuto then delivered the clutch hit the Phillies badly needed against the 103-loss Orioles. The Phillies entered three games behind Atlanta in the NL East and are chasing three teams for the second NL wild-card spot. Austin Hayes drove in automatic runner Cedric Mullins with a single off Ian Kennedy (3-1) in the 10th inning. But Realmuto provided the late-game thrill that helped the Phillies rebound from a loss in the opener of the three-game series. Harper was thrown out twice on the basepath and crushed the Phillies with careless baserunning in the eighth. Harper, thrown out at second earlier in the game trying to stretch a double, ripped his career-high 39th double of the season off Fernando Abad to lead off the eighth. He moved to third on a groundout and pinch-hitter Matt Vierling hit a grounder to second baseman Pat Valaika. With the infield in, Valaika nailed Harper standing up at home. Without a fifth starter, the Phillies again turned to a bullpen game in front of a paltry 18,955 announced fans. The Phillies trailed 7-0 to Chicago last Thursday in their previous bullpen outing and rallied for a 17-8 win. Adonis Medina, a 24-year-old righty, lasted 3 2/3 innings in his first start and only second appearance of the season. Medina gave up a leadoff double to Cedric Mullins and then drilled Austin Hays in the back in the first inning but pitched out of the jam. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn He went 4-5 with a 5.05 ERA in 17 starts this season for Triple-A Lehigh Valley. ‚ÄúI figured he was going to pitch at some point during this game tonight anyway, so why not do something that he‚Äôs comfortable with and start him?‚Äù manager Joe Girardi said. Ramon Urias‚Äô RBI single to center off Medina in the fourth gave the Orioles a 1-0 lead. TRAINER‚ÄôS ROOM Orioles: OF DJ Stewart was placed on the 60-day injured list. He‚Äôll have right knee surgery in the coming days and manager Brandon Hyde said that he should be ready for spring training. Hyde said that Stewart, who hit .204 with 12 home runs and 33 RBIs, had been getting treatment for the injury for some time. ‚ÄúEverybody felt it was the right time for him to shut (it) down and take care of it and be ready for spring training next year,‚Äù Hyde said. UP NEXT The Phillies send ace RHP Zack Wheeler (14-9, 2.83 ERA, 231 strikeouts) to the mound against Baltimore LHP Keegan Akin (2-10, 6.93). headline: Residents & Business Owners Question The Future Of The Inner Harbor‚Äôs Gallery Mall
summary: It's been a longtime shopping destination in Baltimore but now there are questions about the future of the Gallery mall at the Inner Harbor.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî  It‚Äôs been a longtime shopping destination in Baltimore but now there are questions about the future of the Gallery mall at the Inner Harbor. WJZ has learned that some business owners at the mall are preparing to pack up their stores because they have been told there is a possibility the mall may close by the end of the year. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured ‚ÄúRight now we don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs going on,‚Äù said Luis Medina, the owner of La Mesa. ‚ÄúThey told us in July that the last day would be in September and they contacted me again and said now it‚Äôs going to be December. So we don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs going on, what they are trying to do.‚Äù WJZ contacted the New York-based Brookfield Properties which owns the Gallery. The company would not confirm nor deny if the mall will close by the end of the year but in emailed statements, a spokesperson said ‚ÄúWe are currently evaluating several potential options to reposition the Gallery that will meet the needs of the market.‚Äù Loyola University associate professor PJ Krahel said the internet is running brick and mortar stores out of business. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a combination of the increase in online sales,‚Äù said Krahel. ‚ÄúIf I can get more variety at home potentially at a lower price without having to go anywhere, a lot of the appeal at the mall kind of diminishes.‚Äù READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn A spokesperson from Mayor Brandon Scott‚Äôs office issued a statement which said ‚ÄúThe City will continue to work with Brookfield as they consider options for significant improvements and investment in the Gallery to meet the needs of the market.‚Äù If the Gallery mall closes, there are folks who will miss it. ‚ÄúSo many people don‚Äôt have transportation to get to the malls and other places and stuff, so it would be a great loss I believe if they would close it,‚Äù said Vivian Ray of Baltimore. Store owners like Medina are hoping they will get a clear answer on what the future will bring. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs really hard because we cannot plan production, we cannot plan the retail part, you cannot plan anything, you cannot plan life, really,‚Äù said Medina. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs going to happen after December, what I‚Äôm going to do.‚Äù

I believe that‚Äôs coming. It can‚Äôt come soon enough. When we do that I believe that we will be able to make some serious progress and beat this virus once and for all,‚Äù Pittman said at a news briefing Tuesday.   Anne Arundel County‚Äôs Executive says he is ‚Äúlooking forward to the day‚Äù when vaccines will be required for children to come to school. ‚ÄúIt can‚Äôt come soon enough.‚Äù  @wjz   #COVID19   pic.twitter.com/SWxhlXF9Je   ‚Äî Mike Hellgren (@HellgrenWJZ)  September 21, 2021 ‚ÄúFor the student-athletes in particular it‚Äôs going to keep them healthy and on the field,‚Äù said Dr. Nilesh Kalyanaraman, the county‚Äôs health officer. Some people have reactions to it,‚Äù Mondor said.   In Anne Arundel County, 1,092 students and 21 staff members are in quarantine  #COVID19   @wjz   pic.twitter.com/prZb0GkgRK   ‚Äî Mike Hellgren (@HellgrenWJZ)  September 21, 2021 It comes as 1,092 students and 21 staff members are now in quarantine in Anne Arundel County Public Schools, almost double last week‚Äôs numbers. 170 students and 14 staff have active COVID‚Äî19 cases. Natasha Freeman has two children in the county‚Äôs school system. She told WJZ Investigator Mike Hellgren she agrees with the latest vaccine mandates. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn ‚ÄúOne of my children is disabled. I feel safer for them going to school with vaccinated people. I‚Äôm vaccinated,‚Äù Freeman said. ‚ÄúIf the teachers have to be vaccinated, the students should be vaccinated too.‚Äù She praised the school system‚Äôs actions as they work to prevent new infections. ‚ÄúThe county sends out emails. They don‚Äôt let them get on a bus without masks. They don‚Äôt let them come in the school without their masks. They‚Äôve been pretty good with us so far,‚Äù she said.   46 new deaths reported in Maryland today due to  #COVID19 ; 974 new cases. Positivity is up, hospitalizations stayed the same  @wjz   pic.twitter.com/Qzb52vBZZo   ‚Äî Mike Hellgren (@HellgrenWJZ)  September 21, 2021 The county‚Äôs school board meets at 6 p.m. Wednesday and will be open to the public. All attendees must be masked and are ‚Äúsubject to normal space limitations in the board room‚Äù school officials said in a statement. Pfizer said this week that its vaccine is safe in children ages 5 to 11. Pfizer is seeking federal government authorization to administer it to them. https://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2021/09/20/parents-react-after-pfizer-announces-its-covid-19-vaccine-is-safe-for-children-between-the-ages-of-5-to-11/ The shots are given at one-third the adult dose. Anne Arundel County‚Äôs health officer Dr. Nilesh Kalyanaraman said Tuesday he is now preparing for when those younger kids can get the vaccine.¬†¬†The county will work with schools, pharmacies and pediatricians. ‚ÄúWe expect an increase in demand for vaccines,‚Äù he said. headline: Shortage In COVID Testing Kits Driving Up Lab-Based Demand

bodytext: DUNDALK, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  A shortage of COVID-19 rapid tests continues nationwide, including at many stores in Maryland. People want to make sure they don‚Äôt have that variant.‚Äù It is unclear what has caused the shortage in over-the-counter test supplies. Many stores with test kits in stock are limiting the number of tests people can buy. ‚ÄúAcross the country, this is happening, where the resources that were going to these testing sites are going toward vaccination,‚Äù Dr. Gigi Gronvall of the Johns Hopkins Center for Health Security said. ‚ÄúRapid tests are really good at determining if something has a lot of virus in their nose at that time. Then, people can take action on it, like, at that time. So, it‚Äôs a really good public health tool and I hope we get more of them.‚Äù READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn Dr. Gronvall said people returning to work and school have driven up the demand for testing and the need to know results quickly. ‚ÄúNot only was there Delta, so there are increased number of cases, but people are going back to school,‚Äù Dr. Gronvall said. ‚ÄúIt really is a shame, because there are so many advantages of these rapid tests.‚Äù A spokesperson for the Maryland Department of Health told WJZ there is no shortage of rapid tests available to schools. headline: Baltimore Siblings Turn Tequila Dream Into Reality
summary: While many of us found new hobbies during the pandemic, a pair of Baltimore siblings used that time to turn a dream into reality: launching a new tequila brand from scratch.
bodytext: OWINGS MILLS, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  While many of us found new hobbies during the pandemic, a pair of Baltimore siblings spent that time turning a dream into reality: launching a new tequila brand from scratch. ‚ÄúI just saw an opportunity and I just seized it,‚Äù said Donta Henson, chief executive officer and co-founder of Los Hermanos Tequila. The local Black-owned, veteran-owned business takes much of its identity from the siblings. Los Hermanos means ‚Äúthe brothers‚Äù in Spanish and 1978 is named in honor of Donta‚Äôs birth year. William tells WJZ the brothers have been close since they were young and have always shared an extraordinary bond. Once they had the idea, it only took a year for them to bring it full circle. ‚ÄúWe decided we had to do something to leave a legacy,‚Äù William said. And so they did. The siblings‚Äô hard work has already begun to pay off. Los Hermanos 1978 was recognized earlier this year by the New York World Wine & Spirits Competition. Starting soon, customers will be able to savor a taste of their success, too. Los Hermanos is set to be sold at Foundry Row Wine & Spirits in Owings Mills. But it‚Äôs worth noting that they say they couldn‚Äôt have accomplished their dream without the backing of their Baltimore community. ‚ÄúI want them to enjoy that and feel like they helped be a part of this process,‚Äù Donta said.
