headline: ‚ÄòI Hope People Laugh As Much As We Did Making It ‚Äò: Asher Grodman On CBS‚Äô Ghosts
summary: The star of CBS' new comedy discusses what fans can expect when they watch the premiere of "Ghosts" on Thursday night.
bodytext: (CBS Local)‚Äì¬† This week, a brand new show is coming to CBS. On Thursday, October 7, a new single-camera comedy called ‚Äú Ghosts ‚Äù starring Utkarsh Ambudkar & Rose McIver premieres at 9pm EST/PST on CBS. The 30 minute comedy is about Samantha and Jay, who throw both caution and money to the wind when they decide to convert a huge rundown country estate they inherited into a bed & breakfast. The only problem is that it‚Äôs inhabited by the many spirits of deceased residents who now call it home. Actor Asher Grodman plays one of the ghosts on the show named Trevor. The departed souls range from a Prohibition lounge singer named Alberta to a slick 90s finance guy in Grodman‚Äôs character Trevor. CBS Local‚Äôs DJ Sixsmith chatted with Grodman about working on the show, providing comedy in this moment and working with Ambudkar. READ MORE:  Amanda Kloots & Akbar Gbajabiamila On CBS‚Äô ‚ÄòThe Talk‚Äô: ‚ÄòNobody Else Is Doing This‚Äô ‚ÄúYou can expect a lot of fun,‚Äù said Grodman. ‚ÄúThe first time I read this script, I said this is one of the funniest things I‚Äôve ever read. I knew it was different and I knew it was special. We were supposed to shoot the pilot in March 2020 on a Monday and the world shut down on the Friday before. In terms of the ensemble, we were all living in limbo for a year and a half and all of us just got really close. We shared this journey and we all became really good friends. We relished it.‚Äù READ MORE:  WATCH: Kimiko Glenn On Nickelodeon‚Äôs ‚ÄòBaby Shark‚Äôs Big Show‚Äô & ‚ÄòOrange Is The New Black‚Äô Each episode of ‚ÄúGhosts‚Äù will be available on Paramount+ after airing on CBS. Samantha and Jay can‚Äôt see the ghosts when they first move in, but the situation changes when Samantha sustains an injury in the house and suddenly the ghosts are right in front of her. Grodman loves the comedic tone of this show and he thinks the CBS audience will fall in love with it. MORE NEWS:  ‚ÄòIt Was Like A Master Class Watching Jeff Daniels & Maura Tierney: Rob Yang On Showtime‚Äôs ‚ÄòAmerican Rust‚Äô ‚ÄúThis is a team sport. They rebuilt this house in Montreal and the attention to detail is incredible,‚Äù said Grodman. ‚ÄúThe cast is so special and it really comes down to the people and the work that goes into it. The scripts are great and I‚Äôm blown away by how talented these people are. I hope people are going to love the show and laugh as much as we did making it and get a little bit of a release.‚Äù

headline: Experts Say Prices At Grocery Stores Will Continue To Rise For Over A Year
summary: According to new figures released by the labor department, wholesale inflation jumped 8.3 percent from August of this year compared to August of 2020.
bodytext: LOS ANGELES (CBSLA)  ‚Äî If you think you‚Äôre paying more at the grocery store ‚Äì you‚Äôre not wrong. Wholesale prices are at a record high and some supplies are scarce. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured One woman said her grocery bill has been slowly climbing over the past few weeks. ‚ÄúThe prices are just so high,‚Äù she said. She‚Äôs not alone. ‚ÄúEverything just seems to be a dollar to two dollars higher,‚Äù said shopper Kathleen Postal. ‚ÄúThis creep has just happened and it‚Äôs very expensive.‚Äù ‚ÄúPrices are going up high,‚Äù said shopper Irwin Ginsburg. According to new figures released by the labor department, wholesale inflation jumped 8.3 percent from August of this year compared to August of 2020. That‚Äôs the biggest gain on record since the department started tracking it more than a decade ago. ‚ÄúWe haven‚Äôt seen anything yet,‚Äù said SuperMarketGuru.Com‚Äôs Phil Lembert. ‚ÄúPrices are going to continue to go up for a good year and a half.‚Äù READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn Lembert is the editor of SuperMarketGuru.Com and a food industry analyst. ‚ÄúThe biggest increases we will see has to do with animals,‚Äù he said, ‚ÄúWhether it‚Äôs eggs or milk or pork or beef.‚Äù Fires up north have decimated their feed. Supply chain issues like bottlenecks at the Port of Los Angeles and labor shortages are also to blame. ‚ÄúWe have a huge problem with a lack of truck drivers,‚Äù Lembert said. ‚ÄúRefrigerated transport is up 10.4 percent in cost.‚Äù As prices increase, supplies have decreased. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre just having a hard time finding the types of things we want,‚Äù Postal said. At the grocery stores CBSLA‚Äôs Kristine Lazar visited, she saw a limited supply of things like milk, butter, soda, snacks, paper products and baking supplies. ‚ÄúRetailers who are filling out their orders to fill their shelves are not getting what they order,‚Äù Lembert said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs estimated to be anywhere between 50 and 70 percent of what they order.‚Äù MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government Experts say it still pays to shop around. Shoppers may want to try independent grocers or stores with different business models like The Dollar Store or Aldi.

headline: Baltimore Man, 27, Dies After Dirt Bike Crash In Brooklyn Park
summary: Investigators said on September 30 around 7 p.m., a dirt bike traveling north on Kramme Avenue ran a stop sign, striking a car traveling west on Audrey Avenue.
bodytext: BROOKLYN PARK, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  A Baltimore man died after a dirt bike crash in Brooklyn Park last Thursday, Anne Arundel County Police said.   Investigators said on September 30 around 7 p.m., a dirt bike traveling north on Kramme Avenue ran a stop sign, striking a car traveling west on Audrey Avenue. The driver, identified as 27-year-old Conner Riggins, was thrown from the bike.   Paramedics transported Riggins to an area trauma center where he later died, police said.   The primary cause of the crash is Riggins failing to stop at the stop sign. The crash remains under investigation.

headline: Maryland‚Äôs Congressional Democrats Call On State To Use $2.5B Surplus To ‚ÄòSupport Those Who Need It Most‚Äô
summary: In a joint statement, Maryland's Congressional Democrats called on the state to use its $2.5 billion budget surplus to "support those who need it most," with many families facing eviction and struggling to pay childcare.
bodytext: WASHINGTON (WJZ) ‚Äî In a joint statement, Maryland‚Äôs Congressional Democrats called on the state to use its $2.5 billion budget surplus to ‚Äúsupport those who need it most,‚Äù with many families facing eviction and struggling to pay childcare. ‚ÄúGiven this reality, we hope the State will work to support those who need it most, including by expediting release of federal funds allocated to that purpose,‚Äù U.S. Sens. Ben Cardin and Chris Van Hollen, and Reps. Steny H. Hoyer, Dutch Ruppersberger, John Sarbanes, Kweisi Mfume, Anthony Brown, Jamie Raskin, and David Trone said. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured Comptroller Peter Franchot, whose office  announced the surplus  in late September, made a similar pitch for the excess money in the state‚Äôs General Fund, saying there‚Äôs a ‚Äútale of two Marylands.‚Äù In one, hundreds of thousands see their unemployment expiring, face homelessness, are returning to work can‚Äôt find affordable childcare, or struggle running their small business, he said. In the other, representing roughly two-thirds of the population, residents with stable jobs that let them work remotely have been able to invest. ‚ÄúThe state‚Äôs surplus is a once-in-a-generation opportunity to invest in programs that lift all Marylanders and help stabilize housing and other critical expenses for our lower- and middle-income families,‚Äù Franchot said. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn Federal stimulus money drove larger-than-expected revenue growth in the state, Franchot‚Äôs office said. Franchot is a Democratic candidate for governor. In response to news of the surplus, Gov. Larry Hogan released a statement pledging to ‚Äúcontinue to practice fiscal discipline while prioritizing relief that advances our recovery.‚Äù In their statement Wednesday, the Congressional Democrats said they‚Äôve secured $11.9 billion in American Rescue Plans money for Maryland, including $5.37 billion paid directly to the state government. ‚ÄúOver the last year, Federal Team Maryland has fought tooth and nail to provide federal funds to support our state. We are glad to have helped secure Maryland‚Äôs strong fiscal footing and a $2.5 billion budget surplus,‚Äù the lawmakers said. ‚ÄúBut the work to protect Marylanders from the impact of COVID-19 is not done ‚Äì many are still grappling with the devastating impacts of the pandemic.‚Äù MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government ¬†

headline: Growth Plate Fractures In Children: Why They‚Äôre Not As Devastating As They Can Seem
summary: A parent bracing for the prognosis of their child‚Äôs broken bone might hear ‚Äúgrowth plate fracture‚Äù and immediately think unfixable damage has been done.
bodytext: A parent bracing for the prognosis of their child‚Äôs broken bone might hear ‚Äúgrowth plate fracture‚Äù and immediately think unfixable damage has been done.   Certainly, growth plate fractures should be diagnosed and treated promptly. Pediatric fractures in general heal differently than adult fractures and can affect a child‚Äôs future growth potential. Growth plate fractures pose additional risks‚Äîmainly the potential for a deformity that can develop months or perhaps years down the road‚Äîand can be hard to identify on a standard X-ray, making an examination by a pediatric orthopedist or other expert in children‚Äôs skeletal injuries more critical.   ‚ÄúIn the long term, you can get limb length discrepancies or an angular deformity where part of the growth plate shuts down from the trauma and another part keeps growing. That‚Äôs the main thing you worry about after a growth plate fracture,‚Äù says Philip K. McClure, M.D., FAAOS, a board-certified orthopedic surgeon specializing in limb lengthening and reconstruction, and assistant director of the International Center for Limb Lengthening at the  Rubin Institute for Advanced Orthopedics (RIAO) , a LifeBridge Health center.   However, a growth plate fracture isn‚Äôt as bleak as its name might suggest. Here‚Äôs why outcomes are often favorable with prompt attention and treatment even if a deformity eventually does develop:   What is a growth plate?   As can be inferred from the name, growth plates control how bones grow, determining their length and shape. Made up of cartilage, they are located at the ends of long bones (the thighbone and the metacarpal bones in your hands, for example), near joints. Growth plates disappear when a child reaches maturity (or has fully grown), but they are the last portion of children‚Äôs bones to harden, which is why they‚Äôre so susceptible to injury during the growth process.   A growth plate can fracture the same way a bone can fracture. Growth plate fractures are commonly caused by falls. They can also occur during participation in sports such as football, soccer or gymnastics. Also, they can occur gradually due to repetitive stress on the bone, which can result from overtraining. Recreational activities like skateboarding, biking and trampolining also put children at increased risk of a growth plate fracture.   Technically, all growing children are at risk of growth plate fractures, but boys more so than girls because it takes boys longer to finish growing. Growth plate fractures typically occur in the lower legs, forearms and fingers. The immediate symptoms‚Äîpain and swelling‚Äîwill feel a lot like those of any other fracture, which is more reason for children to see an orthopedist or other skeletal growth specialist in the event of a fracture to determine if a growth plate has been damaged.   Is surgery necessary?   The risk of future problems resulting from growth plate fractures will depend on multiple factors, including the child‚Äôs age. Growth plate fractures tend to be less consequential if they occur near the end of growth. (Usually, growth plates in the arms and legs disappear at age 14 in girls and age 16 in boys.)   ‚ÄúA 16-year-old boy who suffers a growth plate fracture‚Äîonce you get the fracture fixed and it heals, it‚Äôs unlikely to cause problems for him, whereas in a six-year-old boy, it can be a very different story because even if you get the fracture to heal and align nicely, the child still might require treatment down the line for a deformity,‚Äù McClure says.   That concern for what‚Äôs also known as a ‚Äúgrowth arrest,‚Äù which can cause a bone to grow unevenly and become crooked even after a fracture heals, is why ‚Äúsome children should continue to have follow-up visits with a specialist until they‚Äôve finished growing, into the late teenage years,‚Äù McClure says.   With proper treatment, most growth plate fractures heal without complications. And while all growth plate fractures need treatment, not all of them will require surgery. ‚ÄúSome sort of immobilization is almost always needed, but most growth plate fractures can be repositioned without surgery and then held in a cast while they heal,‚Äù McClure says.   Also, it is important to know that deformities can be corrected though a limb lengthening procedure or osteotomy (surgery that involves cutting and reshaping the bone).   ‚ÄúSome patients get the sense that if they develop a deformity, there‚Äôs nothing that can be done about it, but that‚Äôs not true. Even people who‚Äôve had a deformity for 10 or 20 years can be corrected in most cases,‚Äù McClure says. ‚ÄúDeformities can be treated at almost any age, easily into a person‚Äôs 60s, though after longer periods of time arthritis and other complications can arise.‚Äù   RIAO has a Pediatric Fracture Clinic that offers same- and next-day appointments five days a week at Sinai Hospital of Baltimore and on Mondays¬†and Thursdays¬†at Foundry Row in Owings Mills, Maryland. If you are seeking fracture care for your child, please call 410-601-BONE (2663) to make an appointment with our expert pediatric orthopedic team.   Call 410-601-WELL or visit lifebridgehealth.org to learn more about all other services offered by LifeBridge Health, including specialty care and community events.

keywords: maryland durable medical equipment re-use program
headline: Maryland Residents Eligible For Free Medical Equipment Under Re-Use Program
summary: Ten percent of Maryland adults have a mobility-related disability, according to the CDC report.
bodytext: ANNAPOLIS, Md. (AP) ‚Äî  From the moment doctors said she would have to undergo intensive foot surgery, Prince George‚Äôs County resident Janice Joyner knew she would have to pay for more than just a procedure. A mobility device was needed for her recovery. However, Joyner said, Medicare couldn‚Äôt cover the cost of the scooter. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured ‚ÄúI was searching online for some kind of equipment that could help me and I didn‚Äôt want to pay an arm and a leg for it,‚Äù she said. After numerous Google searches, she said she came across the Maryland Durable Medical Equipment Re-Use Program. This program provides Maryland residents with donated equipment ‚Äî such as wheelchairs, walkers, hospital beds, scooters and even pediatric equipment that have been sanitized and repaired ‚Äî at no cost. Applicants do not have to meet any income requirements to receive equipment. Marylanders with any disability, illness or injury can receive this equipment regardless of age, according to the program website. Joyner said she thought the program was too good to be true. ‚ÄúAt first I was skeptical (wondering) ‚ÄòWhy is this place offering free resources?‚Äô,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúBut everything on there was true and I was amazed.‚Äù Disability healthcare costs in Maryland can reach as high as $21,118 per person each year, according to a 2019 Disability and Health Data report the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention issued. After a month and a half of mobility assistance, Joyner said, she plans on returning her scooter to the program‚Äôs headquarters for another person to use. ‚ÄúBefore, I could only hop five steps to my bathroom and back,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúHaving this scooter made it possible for me to get out of bed. ‚Äù Ten percent of Maryland adults have a mobility-related disability, according to the CDC report. This makes it the highest reported disability among other types such as cognitive, self-care and independent living. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn Program Director Ian Edwards said despite numerous attempts to raise awareness for this program, many people still don‚Äôt know it exists. ‚ÄúWe started things up in January but with COVID fears, we weren‚Äôt really sure how the program would be perceived because it is previously used equipment,‚Äù he said. Once the majority of Marylanders received their vaccines, Edwards said more equipment started going out to the public in March. ‚ÄúWe faced a lot of difficulties at the start,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúBut the equipment is (now) here and we have it ready for people who have no other means of obtaining it.‚Äù Edwards said the program has received over 5,000 items since collections began. Although the program does not currently deliver, he said they have multiple satellite sites around the state where people can pick up equipment. The program hosts 11 donation centers across the state, including three major landfills where people can drop off equipment. Edwards told Capital News Service that they partnered with county landfills to set up containers and raise awareness for the re-use program. He said while the program serves to help residents, they also want to ease financial strains among other contributors. ‚ÄúWhether it‚Äôs the healthcare system, hospital providers or even Medicare,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIf we can save them money, with the inventory we have now, we‚Äôre hoping to help in any way.‚Äù Secretary of Aging Rona Kramer said Maryland is the first state to offer this statewide durable reuse program. ‚ÄúThere are very few programs in the country that are this expansive,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúWe have the most sophisticated one. We are giving people their lives back.‚Äù More information about the program:  https://aging.maryland.gov/pages/DME.aspx MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government (¬© Copyright 2021 The Associated Press. All Rights Reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.)

bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ)  ‚Äî Applications for sports wagering licenses from Maryland‚Äôs three largest casinos have been forwarded to a state commission for final approval, the Maryland Lottery and Gaming Control Commission said Wednesday. Horseshoe Casino in Baltimore, Live! Casino and Hotel in Hanover and MGM National Harbor in Oxon Hill will now seek the formal approval of the Sports Wagering Application Review Commission (SWARC) at its Oct. 14 meeting. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre pleased to have these three applicants approved and move them along to the SWARC,‚Äù said Maryland Lottery and Gaming Director John Martin. ‚ÄúOur team is diligently implementing the sports wagering law, and we‚Äôre one step closer to the first in-person wagers, which we hope will take place by late fall.‚Äù The casinos are three of 17 businesses that were named in the law to legalize sports wagering as potential sites for sports books, pending a review of their qualifications, the gaming commission said. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn In August, SWARC voted unanimously that the gaming commission‚Äôs qualification standards are sufficient for determining how to award sports wagering licenses. The gaming commission determined the three casinos meet the criteria. Maryland‚Äôs six casinos brought in $165.4 million in revenue last month, according to the most recent data from the gaming commission. MGM National Harbor led the way with nearly $69.5 million, followed by Live! Casino and Hotel at nearly $56.5 million. headline: Black Bear Activity Expected To Increase In Maryland, Officials Remind Residents To Take Precautions
summary: The Maryland Department of Natural Resources said the state's black bears are concentrated in Allegany, Frederick, Garrett, and Washington counties.
bodytext: ANNAPOLIS, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  Fall in Maryland is time for the state‚Äôs black bears to start a period of increased feeding ahead of winter hibernation, and that means those in western Maryland might start seeing more bear activity. The Maryland Department of Natural Resources said the state‚Äôs black bears are concentrated in Allegany, Frederick, Garrett, and Washington counties. The department¬†wants to remind residents to take common-sense precautions to avoid close encounters with the animals. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured ‚ÄúKeeping food sources like bird feeders, pet food, and trash in a place where bears can‚Äôt get to them is the best way to avoid problems,‚Äù¬† Wildlife and Heritage Service ¬†Director Paul Peditto said. The department said motorists traveling in western Maryland should also watch for bears crossing roads in search of food. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn The department provided these pointers to minimize bear problems on property:   Reduce garbage odors. Rinse food cans and wrappers before disposal.   Compost vegetable scraps properly away from house.   Keep meat scraps in the freezer until garbage pickup day.   Wash garbage cans regularly and use lime to cut odors.   Keep garbage cans in a bear-proof container or in an enclosed building until trash pickup.¬† See links to bear-proof cans above. ‚Äã   Remove bird feeders in the spring. If you persist in feeding during summer, remove seed, suet and hummingbird feeders at night.   Keep pet food inside.   Keep barbecue grills and picnic tables clean.   Use an energized fence to keep bears out of beehives, sweet corn, fruit trees and berry patches. (An energized fence is powered by a low-impedance, high‚Äìvoltage energizer that provides a short-duration, high-energy impulse.)   Barking dogs, bright lights and noisemakers will sometimes discourage bears from coming into an area.   For more information on living around black bears,  visit the department‚Äôs website. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government ¬†

bodytext: ELLICOTT CITY, Md. As we confront the threat of climate change, we must enact thoughtful policy that ensures we protect and preserve agricultural land and support the many people whose livelihoods depend on our farms.‚Äù READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured The overall cost of the easement is $5.4 million, the county said. headline: Gov. Hogan Unveils $3.2M In Incentives For Maryland Businesses To Hire Apprentices
summary: The state of Maryland is investing $3.2 million in a program to offer financial incentives to businesses that hire apprentices and provide them with on-the-job training, Gov. Larry Hogan announced Wednesday.
bodytext: ANNAPOLIS, Md. ‚Äî  The state of Maryland is investing $3.2 million in a program to offer financial incentives to businesses that hire apprentices and provide them with on-the-job training, Gov. Larry Hogan announced Wednesday. Through the Employer Incentive Plan (EIP), businesses with at least 50 employees can get reimbursed for half of the wages paid to registered apprentices, according to the governor‚Äôs office. The state will foot the bill for 75 percent of apprentices‚Äô wages for eligible businesses with fewer than 50 employees on the payroll. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured The goal is to boost participation in the state‚Äôs registered apprenticeship program, which provides a two-fold benefit. On one hand, apprentices gain a steady paycheck and work experience. On the other, employers expand their talent pipeline. ‚ÄúBy investing in this new Employer Incentive Plan, we are supporting the growth and future of Maryland‚Äôs highly successful Registered  Apprenticeship  programs, sponsors, employers, and apprentices,‚Äù Gov. Hogan said in part. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn The EIP would reimburse larger businesses (50 or more employees) for apprentices‚Äô wages up to $3,120 for as many as 30 hours a week, while smaller businesses (fewer than 50 employees) could get paid back up to $4,680 for the same number of hours. According to figures provided by the governor‚Äôs office, Maryland currently has more than 11,000 registered apprentices in the state‚Äôs workforce, representing the highest participation seen since the apprenticeship program began. ‚ÄúMaryland continues to be a national leader in workforce development, job training, and  apprenticeship s, and it is critical that we continue to invest in our skilled workforce,‚Äù the governor said. ‚Äú Apprenticeship s have proven to be a tremendously successful workforce development strategy, and I encourage businesses from all industries to utilize this program.‚Äù MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government The EIP isn‚Äôt limited to private businesses. Public businesses and nonprofit groups can also apply to participate in the program,  as long as they meet the state‚Äôs eligibility criteria .

headline: Jeffrey Burnham, Maryland Man Charged In 3 Murders, Believed His Brother Was ‚ÄòKilling People With the COVID Shot‚Äô

bodytext: ELLICOTT CITY, Md. (WJZ)  ‚Äî Jeffrey Burnham, the Cumberland man charged with killing his brother, sister-in-law and an elderly family friend, allegedly wanted to confront his brother Brian Robinette, a pharmacist, because he believed the government is ‚Äúpoisoning people with COVID vaccines,‚Äù according to charging documents filed Wednesday in the District Court of Maryland for Howard County. ‚ÄúBrian knows something!‚Äù he told his mother, according to charging documents. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured Burnham, 46, is currently being held in the the Allegany County Detention Center. He‚Äôs charged with first-degree murder in the killing of 83-year-old Rebecca Reynolds, who was found dead Sept. 29 in a Cumberland home. At the time Reynolds‚Äô body was discovered, her vehicle was missing. Howard County authorities on Wednesday charged Burnham with two counts of first-degree murder, two counts of second-degree murder and one handgun charge in the death of his brother and Brian‚Äôs wife Kelly. According to charging documents, Burnham‚Äôs mother Evelyn called the Cumberland Police Department on Sept. 29 because her son was making statements about the FBI coming after them and she was concerned ‚Äúregarding his mental health and stability.‚Äù As part of the investigation into Reynolds‚Äô death, Cumberland police contacted Howard County authorities on Sept. 30 with a search warrant for a residence at 5368 Kerger Road in Ellicott City. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn The Howard County Police Department‚Äôs tactical unit entered the house and found the Robinettes with gun shot wounds and multiple spent 40-caliber casings, the charging documents said. Reynolds‚Äô vehicle was located a short distance away, but Brian Robinette‚Äôs 2007 Corvette was missing. Evelyn Burnham called police a second time and told authorities her son had told her he needed to return Reynolds‚Äô car. She also told police Jeffrey wanted to confront his brother about the COVID-19 vaccine, believing the government was using the shot to poison people. A tipster contacted Maryland State Police and said Burnham appeared at their house in a red Corvette around 4:45 p.m. on Sept. 30 asking for gas money. Burnham told the person they would see him on TV and said his brother was ‚Äúkilling people with the COVID shot.‚Äù MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government Burnham was arrested on Oct. 1 in West Virginia. Authorities found an empty box of 40-caliber ammunition for a Smith & Wesson handgun during a search of his Cumberland residence.

bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî  Baltimore-based spice and seasoning company McCormick & Co. has announced its first-ever Director of Taco Relations after a  months-long search . The couple has traveled to numerous countries over the course of the blog including China, Thailand and Mexico. Luna is clearly as passionate about tacos as she is about traveling. Just check out this ‚ÄúUltimate El Paso Taco Guide‚Äù the couple released over the summer: The Director of Taco Relations position comes with the hefty responsibility of upkeeping the company‚Äôs corner on the home-cooked taco market. Luna will be compensated with a $100,000 salary, a ton of McCormick gear and, we‚Äôre sure, plenty of tacos. ‚ÄúMcCormick received such an incredible response to this consultant position, and we were floored by not only the number of applications but also the outpouring of love for McCormick Taco Seasoning,‚Äù said¬† Jill Pratt , Chief Marketing Excellence Officer for McCormick. Luna appeared in a video on the spice company‚Äôs Twitter in which she introduces viewers to Birria tacos, a Mexican dish she says not enough people know about.   Hi üëã It‚Äôs Jo Luna, McCormick‚Äôs first ever Director of Taco Relations! Watch me make one of my favorite tacos: Birria Tacos! Try it out for yourself and let me know what you think!  üåÆ https://t.co/W2QDZCrBBy #TacoTuesday   pic.twitter.com/uZzaxq0kKe   ‚Äî McCormick Spices (@mccormickspices)  October 5, 2021 ‚ÄúAmong thousands of creative and fun video submissions, we were impressed with Jo‚Äôs enthusiasm, professionalism and of course her passion for tacos,‚Äù said Pratt. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre confident that Jo is the perfect person to help bring new taco trends to life and develop recipes with our fantastic culinary team as Director of Taco Relations.‚Äù MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government ¬†

headline: Westminster Man Sentenced To 10 Years In Prison For Home Invasion
summary: A Westminister man was sentenced to 10 years followed by five years of supervised probation for a 2019 home invasion.
bodytext: FREDERICK, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  A Westminister man was sentenced to 10 years followed by five years of supervised probation for a 2019 home invasion. Eric Eugene Mooney, 46, entered an Alford plea in August, stating that he does not admit to the criminal act but acknowledges that the evidence presented by the prosecution would be likely to persuade a judge or jury to find him guilty. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured According to authorities, on Oct. 9, 2019, deputies responded to the 5300 block of Legion Drive in Mt. Airy for a reported home invasion. The victim said that just after 8:00 a.m. a white pickup truck pulled into her driveway. Mooney exited the vehicle dressed as a utility worker while wearing an ‚Äúelderly man‚Äù costume mask. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn Officials said the defendant asked the victim, ‚ÄúI want to see if you have power out down there,‚Äù while covering his mouth to disguise his voice. The victim responded with ‚Äúwhat?‚Äù As the victim opened her storm door, Mooney rushed at the victim, grabbing her by the neck and pushing her back inside the house. Officials said he then tied up the victim with zip ties, forced her to give him the combination to open a safe in the home, and made off with approximately $13,000 along with¬†additional valuables. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government Mooney was identified in June 2020 as the suspect, after sunglasses, he wore in the commission of the crime that had been left at the scene tested positive for his DNA.

headline: Family Says ‚ÄòCommunistic California‚Äô Forcing Them To Leave State: ‚ÄòYou Get Taxed For Breathing‚Äô
summary: A Sacramento couple is leaving the state because they claim they're fed up with "Communistic California" in more ways than one.
bodytext: SACRAMENTO, Calif. (KOVR-TV) ‚Äì  A Sacramento couple is leaving the state because they claim they‚Äôre fed up with California in more ways than one. There is no question why Trever Huft and his girlfriend are packing their bags and leaving California. The Natomas residents are sending one last message before they drive to the Lone Star State. Huft wrote on the back of his pick-up truck ‚ÄúLeaving communistic California!‚Äù READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured   Trever Huft   ‚ÄúI feel like that really sums it up: you do what you are told,‚Äù he explained. ‚ÄùThe deciding factor for me is when they required my girlfriend to get a vaccination just to apply for a job.‚Äù It‚Äôs not just COVID policies, it‚Äôs politics, cost of living, and the baby the couple has on the way all factoring into their decision.¬†‚ÄúYou get taxed for breathing here, it‚Äôs horrible,‚Äù explained Huft. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not life, that‚Äôs just going to work and trying to figure out where your next meal is,‚Äù he said. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn So just how many people could be packing up? A  UC study  found 23 percent of California voters are considering leaving the state. ‚ÄúIn 2019 we saw 653,000 residents leave and only 480,000 people come‚Ä¶so there is a gap but that‚Äôs normal in California,‚Äù explained Ryan Lundquist, a Sacramento area certified appraiser and housing analyst. It‚Äôs not the number of Californians exiting but the reason why Texas ranked the top destination.¬†‚ÄúWhen people are going to Texas it‚Äôs usually about lifestyle. People wanted less regulations, less rules, affordability‚Ä¶you can get so much more home in most portions of Texas compared to California,‚Äù explained Lundquist. Huft is now looking to set roots in a new home before his first child is born.¬†‚ÄúAs a father, I want to protect them as much as I can and that is definitely not going to happen here,‚Äù he explained. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government He and his family left for Texas on Tuesday. He says his mother is considering moving as well.

headline: Times Square With Baltimore Flavor: New Digital Billboards Could Soon Light Up Downtown
summary: Think Vegas, Times Square vibes, and infuse that with some Baltimore flavor-- the perfect taste of the lights, activity, energy and experience that's just right for Charm City.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ)  ‚Äî Think Vegas, Times Square vibes, and infuse that with some Baltimore flavor‚Äìthe perfect mix of the lights, energy and experience that‚Äôs just right for Charm City. City leaders say this project has the potential to transform Baltimore. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured ‚ÄúThis is a major attraction and a game-changer for our city,‚Äù said Shelonda Stokes, president of the Downtown Partnership. ‚ÄúBring some lights to the city. Like, we need it,‚Äù said Baltimore resident Eric Fitzgerald Jr. ‚ÄúLook, we need it.‚Äù ‚ÄúI close my eyes and I just imagine when I wake up, what you see behind me is all digital,‚Äù said Stokes. It‚Äôs the latest revitalization effort led by the Downtown Partnership of Baltimore and City Councilman Eric Costello. ‚ÄúWere really excited about bringing motion, art and light into downtown in a vibrant way,‚Äù said Stokes. They‚Äôre proposing a new district called ‚ÄúNo-Ha‚Äù that would allow large digital signage on buildings to illuminate the city from Camden Yards to the Baltimore Convention Center to President Street. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre talking about a vibrant signs,‚Äù said Stokes. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre talking about ones that do have some amount of advertising, but they‚Äôre also infused with art.‚Äù The hope is to bring a fresh new look and experience downtown.. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn ‚ÄúBring New York, Vegas‚Äìwhat? Lets see that, I would love to see that,‚Äù said Fitzgerald. ‚ÄúWow. Like, Ohhh, it‚Äôs the lights.‚Äù ‚ÄúSince this pandemic, things have changed a lot, a lot of the businesses down here has closed, a lot of the restaurants have closed,‚Äù said Gary Monroe, who works downtown. ‚ÄúSo we need something to bring the city back to life.‚Äù Property owners and the arts and entertainment districts would also collect revenue from these billboards. ‚ÄúWe also wanted to make sure that the broader Baltimore community could benefit,‚Äù said Stokes. People who live in the area said they see a bright future for digital displays in Charm City. ‚ÄúI cant wait to see it,‚Äù said Fitzgerald. ‚ÄúWow!‚Äù Officials said this project will not require any funding from the city, they‚Äôll be partnering up with media companies to help cover the cost. The proposed ‚ÄúNo-Ha‚Äù North Harbor district goes before planning commission tomorrow, then it will go before the city council for a final vote later this month. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government Leaders said we could see signs up as early as next year.

headline: 133 Cats Rescued From Baltimore Home In Pet Hoarding Case
summary: More than 130 cats were removed from a Baltimore home Tuesday in an apparent case of animal hoarding.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî  More than 130 cats were removed from a Baltimore home Tuesday in an apparent case of animal hoarding. Baltimore City Animal Control officers visited the Mt. Clare row home in response to a tip from a neighbor who was concerned about the number of cats living there, according to the Baltimore Animal Rescue and Care Shelter. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured Based on the neighbor‚Äôs tip, authorities expected to find about 90 cats inside the home. Instead, they were floored to find the residents were living with 133 cats in conditions that BARCS described as ‚Äúout of control.‚Äù ‚ÄúIt was a very overwhelming situation,‚Äù said Bailey Deacon, director of community engagement for BARCS. ‚ÄúThe state of the house was overwhelming. The owners were overwhelmed.‚Äù After speaking with the homeowners, animal control officers and shelter staff agreed the best move was to remove the cats and take them to BARCS Animal Shelter. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn ‚ÄúTrying to maintain enough litter boxes and clean space for 133 cats is impossible in a space as small as the row home was,‚Äù Deacon said. According to BARCS, the health and temperament of the rescued cats, but many are expected to require ‚Äúextensive medical care.‚Äù Fortunately, none of the cats had died. ‚ÄúA lot of the cats have eye infections that have become pretty extensive where they need their eyes removed,‚Äù said Deacon. ‚ÄúWe had some cats come in that were already missing an eye.‚Äù Since the shelter was already caring for 247 cats before Tuesday‚Äôs discovery, BARCs is asking for the public for donations to help provide the cats with medical care, food and shelter. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government Click here to make a donation.

headline: SportsLine Week 5 AFC East Picks: Jets ‚ÄòHave A Great Chance‚Äô Against Falcons, Says Larry Hartstein
summary: The Jets are tied with the Patriots and Dolphins, while the Bills have jumped out to a 3-1 record and the AFC East lead.
bodytext: ( CBS New York ) ‚Äî  The AFC East has exactly one winning team so far. The Buffalo Bills have rattled off three impressive wins and are playing some of the best football of any team in the NFL. Given preseason expectations, that‚Äôs hardly surprising. What is surprising is their two-game lead on the Miami Dolphins, New England Patriots and New York Jets all sit at 1-3. The Dolphins continue to struggle with Tua Tagovailoa on the mend. The Patriots are seeing progress from their young quarterback, even if it isn‚Äôt consistently showing up in the win column. And the Jets just pulled out a thriller. The Jets and Patriots each have a decent shot at their second win in Week 5. The Jets meet the 1-3 Atlanta Falcons in London, and the Patriots travel to Houston to play the 1-3 Texans. The Dolphins and Bills face more difficult matchups, against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Kansas City Chiefs respectively. READ MORE:  Jackson Leads Ravens Back To 31-25 OT Win Over Colts SportsLine ‚Äòs  Larry Hartstein  breaks down AFC East matchups in Week 5. All times listed are Eastern. New York Jets @ Atlanta Falcons, Sunday, October 10, 9:30 a.m. The New York Jets are coming off their first win of the season, a 27-24 overtime victory over the Tennessee Titans. They‚Äôll look to carry that momentum into London, where they face the Atlanta Falcons. The Falcons dropped another to the Washington Football Team, allowing quarterback Taylor Heinicke to throw two TD passes in the final four minutes. ‚ÄúIf they [the Jets] can keep their emotions in check and not get too high after that big overtime win, I think they have a great chance,‚Äù said Hartstein. ‚ÄúThe Falcons have given up the most points in the league. We saw how Washington put up a lot of points late in that game. The Falcons secondary is horrible. Zach Wilson made some bigtime throws. He has Jamison Crowder back as a safety blanket. He has Corey Davis making big plays.‚Äù Wilson is coming is coming off his best showing so far against the Titans. He piled up 297 yards passing, going 17-27 with two touchdowns. And aside from Crowder and Davis, Keelan Cole caught three passes for 92 yards. The Jets passing game will face a Falcons defense that can‚Äôt stop anybody from scoring. New England Patriots @ Houston Texans, Sunday, October 10, 1:00 p.m. The Patriots couldn‚Äôt overcome the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in Tom Brady‚Äôs return to Foxborough. Brady put together a fourth quarter drive to give the Bucs the lead. The Patriots had a shot at the win, but missed a 56-yard field goal rather than going for the first down. The Houston Texans are a step down from the Buccaneers. And Davis Mills, filling in for the injured Tyrod Taylor, is certainly no Brady. Mills went 19-28 for 168 yards against the Carolina Panthers and 11-21 for 87 yards and four interceptions against the Buffalo Bills. ‚ÄúAre they [the Patriots] going to get a big win over a Houston team that just got blown out 40-0 to Buffalo and looks like the worst team in the league because of their backup quarterback Davis Mills, who‚Äôs clearly not ready?‚Äù asked Hartstein. READ MORE:  Washington Wizards Hold Open Practice At Morgan State University ‚ÄúThe Patriots are not an explosive team,‚Äù Hartstein continued. ‚ÄúYou see them dink and dunk and matriculate their way down the field. They are not the kind of team that‚Äôs looking to put up 40 points. They don‚Äôt play that way. So this is a big number. I can‚Äôt play it right now. If you forced me, I would take the Patriots, just because of how bad Houston is. But I can‚Äôt play it because their offense is not explosive.‚Äù Mac Jones is steadily improving under center for the Patriots. And the Patriots are giving him plenty of opportunities to throw the ball, even if they‚Äôre mostly short passes. The Texans allow 8.1 yards per pass play, among the worst in the league. So this could be an opportunity for Jones to stretch the field a little. Mills, on the other hand, could be in for another long day against a Pats defense that successfully limited Brady. Miami Dolphins @ Tampa Bay Buccaneers, Sunday, October 10, 1:00 p.m. The Dolphins have lost three straight and could easily be 0-4. The  Dolphins defense  is allowing 388.3 yards and 27.3 points per game, both in the NFL‚Äôs bottom 10. They‚Äôve given up at least 20 consecutive points three weeks in a row. Brady will be looking to make it four weeks in a row. Topping the Patriots gave him at least one win over  every team  in the league. He also set the record for regular-season  passing yards  in a career, surpassing Drew Brees. Brady leads the NFL in passing yards this season with 1,356 and has tossed 10 TD passes against only two interceptions. ‚ÄúThey [the Dolphins] have so many problems right now,‚Äù according to Hartstein. ‚ÄúBrian Flores basically saying everything is on the table. Jacoby Brissett has since taking over for Tua been averaging 4.9 yards per attempt. They only started going downfield late in that game, when they were already three scores behind to the Colts. So a lot of issues with the Dolphins offense. And I think the one thing you got to look at is Byron Jones. He‚Äôs their best corner. He left with a quad injury. If he can‚Äôt go against this Buccaneers team, which is loaded with pass catchers, with Mike Evans and [Chris] Godwin and Antonio Brown, it could be a very long day for the Dolphins.‚Äù Buffalo Bills @ Kansas City Chiefs, Sunday, October 10, 8:20 p.m. The Buffalo Bills head to Kansas City for a rematch of last season‚Äôs AFC championship game. The Chiefs won that game, but the Bills are playing better football this season. They are coming off a 40-0 trouncing of the Texans. Buffalo, at 3-1, is the only team in their division with a winning record. They‚Äôre averaging 33.5 points per game, second best in the NFL along with the Chiefs. Kansas City, however, sits at 2-2 after tough losses to the Baltimore Ravens and Los Angeles Chargers. ‚ÄúThey [the Bills] have been the better team this year clearly,‚Äù said Hartstein. ‚ÄúThe Chiefs give up the most yards per play in the league, 6.9. The Bills give up the fewest, 4.0. The Bills invested in their pass rush in the draft. It‚Äôs paying off. They‚Äôre number two in pressure rate. I think they can get a couple of stops on Patrick Mahomes, make him a little bit uncomfortable, so he puts up only in the high 20s, maybe 30. And Buffalo has been unstoppable, 43 points, 40 points, 35 points their last three games. This offense is what we thought it would be, so I‚Äôm definitely leaning towards the Bills.‚Äù The Kansas City defense will have trouble slowing this Buffalo offense. They‚Äôre allowing 437.8 yards and 31.3 points per game, both second worst in the NFL. By comparison, the Bills defense is allowing 216.8 yards and 11 points per game, both tops in the NFL. These stats don‚Äôt necessarily mean Buffalo be able to slow down Patrick Mahomes and his speedy wide receivers, not to mention Travis Kelce. But it does give them a better shot at coming up with a few key plays when it matters. MORE NEWS:  'It's Monday Night Football': Ravens Fans Gearing Up For Tonight's Game Against The Indianapolis Colts Which picks can you make with confidence, and which Super Bowl contender goes down hard?  Visit SportsLine now to see which teams win and cover the spread, all from a proven computer model that has returned almost $7,900 since its inception, and find out.

headline: Baltimore Artist Stephen Towns Featured In Smithsonian‚Äôs National Museum Of African American History And Culture
summary: Each one of the portraits are of people from West Africa who were taken from their homes and forced into the Middle Passage Atlantic slave trade.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ)  ‚Äî Baltimore artist Stephen Towns‚Äô work is now teaching people about a part of American history at the nation‚Äôs largest cultural destination devoted exclusively to documenting and exploring the African American story. ‚ÄúIt still feels surreal, it doesn‚Äôt feel real,‚Äù said Towns. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured These eight pieces of his are now featured at the Smithsonian‚Äôs Museum of African American History and Culture. ‚ÄúThe pieces are called ‚ÄòAn Offering‚Äô as a way of me offering some sort of love to them and honoring their memory,‚Äù said Towns. Each one of the portraits are of people from West Africa who were taken from their homes and forced into the Middle Passage Atlantic slave trade. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll see these little small portraits and you‚Äôll also see that shape of a slave ship created with quilts,‚Äù said Towns. Towns said some of the people depicted have been forgotten, but he wants to make sure they‚Äôre remembered through his work while also inspiring others to learn more about their stories. ‚ÄúI hope that long after I‚Äôm gone that they inspire more work and more research into American history,‚Äù he said. headline: Bob Woodward And Robert Costa Set To Headline Simon & Schuster‚Äôs Inaugural AuthorFest Event

headline: CDC Study: Masking Inside Schools Keeps Children Safe
summary: A new study conducted by the CDC shows children in schools where there is no mask mandate have a higher chance of contracting COVID. If you wear a mask, the transmissibility of the virus is greatly reduced.
bodytext: BEL AIR, Md. (WJZ)  ‚Äî A new study conducted by the CDC shows children in schools where there is no mask mandate have a higher chance of contracting COVID. To some, this is a no-brainer. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured ‚ÄúIf you wear a mask, the transmissibility of the virus is greatly reduced,‚Äù said William Brown, who has school-aged nieces and nephews. In fact, the study shows in schools with a mask mandate the number of kids infected daily, per 100,000, was about 16. That number is about 35 per100,000 kids in schools with no mandate. Some parents say masks don‚Äôt hurt. ‚ÄúThey spread a lot of germs anyway, so whatever we can do to kind of eliminate as much of that as possible, I think, is really positive,‚Äù said Jasmine Mays-Robinson, who has school-aged children. Do masks stop the spread completely? No, but the chief medical information officer for LifeBridge Health said they help keep positive cases low. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn ‚ÄúThere still might be a positive kid here or there who has to be out for a week or two, but we haven‚Äôt seen it going rampantly through because most schools have been vigilant about masking and then quarantining if someone comes up positive,‚Äù said Dr. Jonathan Theirman. WJZ told you about  a rally in Carroll County , organized by parents fighting the mask mandate as their county was one of the only with optional masking before the state stepped in. Now, masks are  mandated in all Maryland public schools . Leaders in Prince George‚Äôs County are taking it a step further, now requiring everyone ages 2 and up to wear masks anywhere indoors. Previously, the mandate was for anyone 5 or older. ‚ÄúAs a parent, I understand it, I get it, I know it‚Äôs not easy to mask younger children. But we‚Äôre doing this based on the data we have and out of a grave concern for our children, many of whom are getting sick,‚Äù said Prince George‚Äôs County Executive Angela Alsobrooks. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government The study was conducted nationwide for the first two weeks of classroom instruction this year.

headline: ‚ÄòI Was Scared,‚Äô Baltimore Man Charged In Towson Crime Spree Tells Judge
summary: A Baltimore man accused of carrying out a "one-man crime spree" Monday in Towson was ordered held without bail Wednesday.
bodytext: TOWSON, Md. ‚Äî  A Baltimore man accused of carrying out a ‚Äúone-man crime spree‚Äù Monday in Towson was ordered held without bail Wednesday. Saying  Zaron Elzey  ‚Äúpresents a risk to the public,‚Äù a judge declined to let the 19-year-old go free while he awaits trial on an extensive list of charges. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured Elzey is  charged with carjacking, first-degree assault, robbery and motor vehicle theft , among several other felony and misdemeanor counts, court records show. Notably, Elzey represented himself at Wednesday‚Äôs hearing because of a delay in the paperwork needed to secure him a public defender. ‚ÄúI was scared,‚Äù Elzey told the judge at one point while speaking in his own defense. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not a bad person.‚Äù The charges stem from a pursuit that began Monday afternoon in Towson and came to an end hours later in Baltimore. About 5 p.m. that day, police were called to an alleged road rage incident near Stevenson Lane after drivers reported seeing a BMW driving erratically. Authorities said things escalated when the vehicle was involved in a hit-and-run crash along Osler Drive, and the driver assaulted a responding officer. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn A mother told police she was driving with her daughter when she encountered the suspect, whom she said followed her and tried to run her off the road. The events unfolding near Towson University‚Äôs campus  led the school‚Äôs administration to issue a shelter-in-place order for students and staff . Police said the suspect eventually got out of the BMW and fled on foot, but then he resurfaced and commandeered another woman‚Äôs Range Rover. That woman told police she tried to run from the man, who knocked her to the ground, grabbed her purse, hopped in the SUV and sped away. It wasn‚Äôt until later on that the pursuit for the stolen vehicle‚Äôs driver came to an end in Baltimore. Police later identified Elzey as the man suspected in that string of incidents. He remains in custody at the Baltimore County jail. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government If convicted of all counts, the 19-year-old could spend decades in prison.

headline: WJZ Exclusive: Baltimore Mayor Brandon Scott Says He‚Äôll Take Wearing Masks ‚ÄòTo The Next Level‚Äô
summary: Baltimore Mayor Brandon Scott remains in quarantine at home, two days after he tested positive twice for COVID-19.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî  Baltimore Mayor Brandon Scott remains in quarantine at home,  two days after he tested positive twice for COVID-19 . In an exclusive interview Wednesday with WJZ, the mayor opened up about the symptoms he‚Äôs dealt with since getting his test results back. He also underscored the need for city residents to get vaccinated to avoid the worst effects of the infection. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured ‚ÄúYesterday, I had a few body aches, but today I feel totally normal,‚Äù Scott told WJZ. Besides those aches, the mayor ‚Äî who had his last public event over the weekend at Patterson Park ‚Äî said he hasn‚Äôt suffered from any other symptoms, such as fever or nausea. ‚ÄúBecause of the vaccine, I‚Äôm able to do this interview at home and not in a hospital bed, not on the ventilator,‚Äù Scott said. Based on his experience, he encouraged everyone to do everything in their power to stay healthy amid the pandemic. That means undergoing testing and getting the vaccine if residents haven‚Äôt already done so. ‚ÄúGet tested,‚Äù Scott said. ‚ÄúGet vaccinated. Protect yourself at all costs.‚Äù As WJZ previously reported, the mayor was vaccinated against the virus in March. His positive test results make him part of the 1 percent of vaccinated Marylanders to get what‚Äôs known as a breakthrough case. It‚Äôs worth mentioning that the COVID-19 vaccine does not protect against infection. Rather, the vaccine is intended to ward off the worst effects of the virus and keep people out of the hospital. Asked if there was something he would do differently, Scott said he would step up his efforts to protect himself while out in public spaces. ‚ÄúFor me, I guess it‚Äôd be taking my mask-wearing to the next level,‚Äù he said. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn The mayor, who is routinely tested, said he is grateful that testing regimen caught his infection early. He took a rapid test Monday morning, followed by a PCR test, which is considered the gold standard for tests. Last week, Scott attended a leadership conference in New York, traveling there by Amtrak train. He said mask usage was enforced in both spaces. He‚Äôs uncertain when he was exposed to the virus. But he suspects it might have occurred on Saturday, the day attended a groundbreaking where he alternated between wearing a mask and going without it. The next day, Scott attended the Parade of Latino Nations in East Baltimore. ‚ÄúWhen you see pictures of me outside without a mask, that‚Äôs very rare, too,‚Äù Scott said. ‚ÄúEven from some of the events over the weeks, folks are like, ‚ÄòHe didn‚Äôt have on a mask.‚Äô There are pictures of me at the same event with a mask,‚Äù he said. The mayor told WJZ he‚Äôs been cooperating with contracting tracing, which entails tracking down people with whom he had close contact over prolonged periods. Few people are considered close contacts. ‚ÄúFifteen minutes, within six feet of each other, having a conversation. That‚Äôs that close contact, but not the quick passing, ‚ÄòHi, bye,‚Äù said Baltimore City Health Commissioner Dr. Dzirasa. Dr. Dzirasa said the mayor‚Äôs infection speaks to the need for unvaccinated residents to get the shot. ‚ÄúWhen we look at who‚Äôs been hospitalized with COVID-19, the vast majority are unvaccinated individuals. I actually think this is a reminder of how important it is to get vaccinated,‚Äù she said. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government According to the mayor‚Äôs staff, he will continue to work from his Northeast Baltimore home until he‚Äôs medically cleared to return to City Hall.

headline: Peabody Institute‚Äôs Manuel Barrueco Nominated For 5th Grammy
summary: Manuel Barrueco knows how to make a guitar sing. After all, the classical guitarist first picked up the instrument six decades ago as a boy in Cuba.
bodytext: LUTHERVILLE-TIMONIUM, Md. (WJZ)  ‚Äî Manuel Barrueco knows how to make a guitar sing. After all, the classical guitarist first picked up the instrument six decades ago as a boy in Cuba. ‚ÄúThe kids in my family were playing ‚Äî my sisters, my cousins. I would just sit there and be mesmerized by it,‚Äù Barrueco said. ‚ÄúI just thought it was the (coolest) thing ever.‚Äù READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured Barrueco, now 68, would emigrate to the United States with his family in 1967, an experience he remembers being painful as a teenager. ‚ÄúWe were leaving everything behind, we came as refugees,‚Äù Barrueco said. ‚ÄúThe Cuban government just took everything you had. And my sister, one of my sisters, was left there, and it was very difficult and very painful.‚Äù His family would eventually settle in Newark, New Jersey. But even as he witnessed his surroundings change dramatically, there always remained one constant: the guitar. ‚ÄúIn times that I, maybe when I‚Äôve gone through a difficult stage in my life, the guitar was there,‚Äù Barrueco said. ‚ÄúIt gave me something to do and to concentrate on.‚Äù He would go on to study at the Peabody Institute in Baltimore. Eventually, he signed a record deal that allowed him to record music and perform around the world. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn Barrueco‚Äôs most recent record earned him his fifth Grammy nomination, a milestone only sweetened by the fact that it was his first with his wife as a producer. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs great,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs actually great to enjoy others enjoying it.‚Äù Now, Barrueco works to spread his love for classical guitar as a teacher at the Peabody Institute of The Johns Hopkins University, a prestigious conservatory and preparatory school for aspiring performers. ‚ÄúSomebody wrote once that music is what feelings sound like,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúSo, I would like to think that through music we can communicate feelings that you can‚Äôt with words. And maybe that is why the arts exist.‚Äù The Latin Grammy Awards is being held on Nov. 18. Barrueco‚Äôs Grammy-nominated record can be found on most streaming platforms. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government His music is available for purchase on Tonar Music . You can  learn more about Barrueco and his journey on his website .

headline: New Details Emerge About Jeffrey Burnham‚Äôs Alleged Killing Spree
summary: Newly released charging documents show that just one day before the murders, Burnham told his mother he was upset his brother Brian, a pharmacist, was administering COVID vaccines.
bodytext: ELLICOTT CITY, Md. (WJZ)  ‚Äî A judge on Wednesday ordered Jeffrey Burnham to remain in the Allegany County Detention Center while awaiting trial in the murder of 83-year-old Rebecca Reynolds last week in Cumberland. But that was only the start of the killing  Burnham is suspected of carrying out . He‚Äôs accused of then driving to Ellicott City, where police say he shot and killed his brother and sister-in-law, Brian and Kelly Sue Robinette. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just horrible in all respects,‚Äù said neighbor Jim Perrus. Burnham is charged with two counts of first-degree murder and two counts of second-degree murder in the death of his brother and sister-in-law. We‚Äôre also learning more about Burnham‚Äôs motives and why his mother contacted police to alert them about his behavior. Newly released  charging documents  show that just one day before the murders, Burnham told his mother he was upset his brother Brian, a pharmacist, was administering COVID vaccines. Her mother told police Burnham said ‚ÄúBrian knows something.‚Äù She said he believed the government was poisoning people with the vaccine, prompting her to contact police to voice concerns about his mental health and stability. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn Last Thursday, police called on the public for help in locating Burnham. The  manhunt  led authorities to capture Burnham  in West Virginia . He was extradited back to Maryland on Tuesday. Outside the Robinettes‚Äô home, a small memorial has been assembled. Friends have set up  a GoFundMe page  for their two children who are now adults. ‚ÄúJust like their parents, nicest kids in the world,‚Äù Perrus said. ‚ÄúAll we can do right at this point is be there and support them.‚Äù MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government Burnham has a preliminary hearing scheduled for early November.

headline: ‚ÄòThis Is Going To Be Georgia‚Äôs First Real Tough Road Test‚Äô: Adam Zucker Previews #2 Georgia Vs #18 Auburn, Plus 6 Other Games
summary: Adam Zucker previews this weekend's college football slate on CBS including #2 Georgia against #18 Auburn and #1 Alabama vs Texas A&M.
bodytext: (CBS Local Sports) ‚Äì¬† College football rolls along this week with a great slate of games across CBS and CBS Sports Network. CBS‚Äô Matt Weiss spoke to CBS Sports‚Äô Adam Zucker about this week‚Äôs matchups including a clash of top 25 teams with Georgia and Auburn plus the number one team in the country, Alabama, heading to College Station to lock horns with the Aggies. #2 Georgia at #18 Auburn: Saturday, October 9, 3:30pm ET on CBS READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Georgia-Auburn and because it‚Äôs at Jordan-Hare Stadium, you never know what might happen. We enjoyed watching the prayer from a few years back on our show Tuesday. My favorite shot is when you see Aaron Murray on the Georgia bench after he had just led them to a presumed victory and he‚Äôll actually be in the booth for us, so I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôre going to have some fun with that. The question is whether Bo Nix can create the kind of magic he did against LSU the other night when Auburn got their first win at Death Valley, since 1999. He was escaping guys like crazy and making making touchdowns and first downs out of it where in the past we used to see him get swallowed up or take monster losses. This Georgia defense, I mean, it‚Äôs as if Bo Nix is going from trying to escape a piranha to trying to escape an Orca or a great white shark. The Georgia defense is at a level that no other defense is at right now coming off two straight shout outs. Even if the Vanderbilt one doesn‚Äôt count in some people‚Äôs minds, the Arkansas, one has to. They‚Äôre allowing under five points per game, allowing a touchdown less than the next best team. Even if their offense isn‚Äôt fully complete, especially with JT Daniels banged up, their defense can win games on its own. They‚Äôve now shut out two straight conference opponents for the first time since their title year 1980. For Auburn beyond the tricks of Nix has the second best average in the country, in terms of yards per carry. I‚Äôm not saying Tank Bigsby and Jarquez Hunter are Cadillac Williams and Ronnie Brown as a duo but they‚Äôre starting to pound out some serious yardage. Beyond the magic of Nix the other night the really impressive football came from those two cats. They also have a defense that‚Äôs pretty darn solid considering what they had to do to get a win at LSU, to almost win at Penn State, and some of the other games that we‚Äôve seen him so far. I think Auburn can hang around, especially if they don‚Äôt make mistakes on their end of the field. Things can get pretty interesting especially because this is going to be Georgia‚Äôs first real tough road test. They had to go to Vanderbilt, the game against Clemson was a neutral site, now this this is a road environment that they haven‚Äôt had yet.‚Äù #1 Alabama at Texas A&M: Saturday, October 9, 8pm ET on CBS ‚ÄúFirst of all, I love that we‚Äôre gonna go from watching Georgia to watching Alabama because while Alabama is number one and the defending champs, a lot of my real diehard film watchers say that Georgia is a better team. Now we get to compare them, not against the same opponent, but we get to watch them on the same day, kick back and enjoy it. Alabama proved, once again, it‚Äôs pretty tough to fool them twice. Even though Ole Miss got them two years in a row a few years ago, for Alabama to go up 35¬† to nothing on Lane Kiffin where everyone had a feeling that Ole Miss could put up some points and really challenge them, that game was out of hand by halftime. If I were Jimbo Fisher, I would not say get your popcorn ready because he already had his big moment in the offseason when he was recorded saying we‚Äôre going to beat his a‚Äì, talking about Coach Saban. To me, this game is almost more about A&M than it is about ‚Äòbama. We all thought A&M would be that second team behind Alabama and I think when you have that label it puts a target on your back. So not only is A&M 0-2 in conference play but their losses to Arkansas and Mississippi State are to the teams that were slated sixth and seventh and in the division to begin the season. So this is an ultimate gut check to me for Texas A&M in this spot because they better keep this thing close because it‚Äôs turning into disaster for Jimbo Fisher. For Alabama, they‚Äôve taken some dings on the injury front and Brian Robinson may not be Najee Harris, but we saw that Alabama still has a guy who is going to put his head down and get a lot of tough yardage the way Najee used to, especially with the injury to Jase McClellan, The Alabama defense really made a big statement in that last game because after Ole Miss had a couple of those fourth down conversions and we thought it was getting interesting, they put a pretty strong stop to it. The defensive line was especially good while the DBs were making sure Matt Corral didn‚Äôt have anybody open.‚Äù Charlotte at FIU: Friday, October 8, 7pm ET on CBS Sports Network ‚ÄúCharlotte is a pretty interesting team to me, they beat Duke in early September, then they had a lead on Illinois this past weekend and right after missing the game tying field goal gave up an 80 yard touchdown so it got out of hand. With Chris Reynolds healthy Charlotte looks like a team that‚Äôs going to start to stick around and maybe rise up in the world, especially for their location. READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn What‚Äôs interesting is they‚Äôve never defeated FIU who‚Äôs 5-0 all time against them. FIU is in some trouble right now though they just gave up over 700 total yards to their rival Florida Atlantic and we we last saw them with that memorable upset over Miami a few years back but they‚Äôve lost 10 straight now to FBS opponents. One guy that‚Äôll be fun to watch for football fans is Max Bortenschlager, he‚Äôs the quarterback for FIU who transferred there after Taulia Tagovailoa came to Maryland, but we always enjoy saying his name. I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôll be saying his name for a lot of good reasons, but he has put up a couple touchdowns in every game so far. I do think that Charlotte would have the edge in that game.‚Äù Northern Illinois at Toledo: Saturday, October 9, 12pm ET on CBS Sports Network ‚ÄúThis is a tough call. Northern Illinois had a nice win over Georgia Tech to start the season and that‚Äôs a Georgia Tech team that has had its ups and downs but showed out in the loss to Clemson and really dominated North Carolina. Then on the other hand Toledo, I thought exposed Notre Dame before a lot of other teams did. They played Notre Dame tough it was a game, not seen on national television, the way we‚Äôre used to it. They‚Äôre now coming home from two straight road games. I think this is a huge game when it comes to the MAC. Toledo with homefield maybe has an edge there, and could claim that they‚Äôre more battle tested but I think that one‚Äôs going to go down to the wire.‚Äù #24 SMU at Navy: Saturday, October 9, 3:30pm ET on CBS Sports Network ‚ÄúI give Navy a shot in this one because of what they were able to do against UCF. It‚Äôs a group of guys who have had their backs to the wall and a coaching staff has already had some turmoil with the way Ivin Jasper was fired and then brought back after the loss to Air Force, which I think was an emotional moment at the academy, obviously. There‚Äôs an extreme contrast between these two teams, SMU is seventh in the country scoring 42 points a game, you have a quarterback in Tanner Mordecai who has thrown 24 touchdowns which is five more than Kenny Pickett for most in the country. Tanner Mordecai is actually even a little bit lower than these other guys in terms of yards per game and attempts per game but he‚Äôs thrown a touchdown every seven and a half attempts. He‚Äôs at like Barry Bonds or Babe Ruth home run proportions here. It‚Äôs a total contrast so I worry because Navy is outside the top 100 in scoring defense, it‚Äôs going to be really key for them to be able to run the ball the way they do. SMU is middle of the pack as a rush defense but Navy isn‚Äôt having a navy kind of year running the ball just yet. Navy could always make it interesting though because of how hard it is to go up against their offense.‚Äù Wyoming at Air Force: Saturday, October 9, 7pm ET on CBS Sports Network ‚ÄúI think that Air Force will win based on what I‚Äôve seen from both teams. I love the Air Force rushing attack right now leading the nation in yards per game and rushing touchdowns because of the offense that they run. Haaziq Daniels, their quarterback, is around six yards a carry. Micah Davis is also going for nine yards a carry. Wyoming has been gritty and is undefeated for a reason though and this is their conference opener and they‚Äôre probably really happy to buckle their seatbelts into Mountain West play after a road escape at UConn and some wild finishes that they‚Äôve already had. Now they‚Äôve had a week off following that, I think they get to hit reset and sink into conference play.‚Äù New Mexico State at Nevada: Saturday, October 9, 10:30pm on CBS Sports Network ‚ÄúThis should be an easy game for Nevada and I don‚Äôt mean to take away from New Mexico State‚Äôs effort¬† and kids on the team trying to make football happen. Nevada‚Äôs only loss was in a visit to a tough Kansas State team who nearly beat Oklahoma, who did beat a Stanford team that‚Äôs completely turned the PAC-12 upside down. They just got a win at Boise State which used to be impossible and I love their offensive balance because of Carson strong and now Toa Taua coming off his best game of the season going for 124 yards at Boise. I think that Nevada should look at this as a way to get some other players on the field and avoid mistakes and treat it like a live tune up for the games they have coming up against Jake Haener and Fresno State on the road and a Hawaii team that just showed what they can do by beating Fresno State and causing six turnovers in that one. MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government The Mountain West, between Nevada and those teams I just mentioned, but also Wyoming and Air Force have shown the Mountain West is going to be really entertaining to watch as we head into the fall.‚Äù

headline: Former Baltimore County Executive Ted Venetoulis Dies At 87
summary: Baltimore County Executive Johnny Olszewski said he is "heartbroken" by the news.
bodytext: TOWSON, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  Former Baltimore County Executive Ted Venetoulis has died at the age of 87, officials announced Thursday. He served as county executive from 1974 to 1978. According to the  Maryland Manual,  Venetoulis, a democrat, was a dedicated public servant, serving on various boards and commissions in Baltimore County and Maryland. His last public position was as the Chair of the Baltimore County Charter Review Commission in 2017. READ MORE:  'He's An Extremely Lucky Individual': Home Explosion In Edgewood Leaves Man Seriously Injured Maryland State Senator Jim Rosapepe said Venetoulis, a friend of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, was ‚Äúa happy warrior for Baltimore.‚Äù ‚ÄúTed was a renaissance man ‚Äî author, public official, entrepreneur, political analyst, and much more,‚Äù said Rosapepe. For decades, he was a happy warrior for Baltimore, for free press and fair elections ‚Äî and for the Democratic Party of FDR, JFK, and his long-time pal Nancy Pelosi. And he was one of my favorite people ‚Äî every time I got off the phone with him, I felt better about everything.‚Äù READ MORE:  Robbery Suspect Found Dead After Shootout With Police In Woodlawn Baltimore County Executive Johnny Olszewski said he is ‚Äúheartbroken‚Äù by the news. ‚ÄúI am heartbroken by the loss of my friend, former County Executive Venetoulis,‚Äù said Olszewski. ‚ÄúOne of our County‚Äôs earliest reformers at a moment when our communities needed it most, I will forever be grateful for the countless ways Ted gave back to our County, our region and our state as well as for his counsel and encouragement to build upon his own rich legacy.‚Äù MORE NEWS:  Annapolis Couple Accused Of Trying To Sell Military Secrets To Foreign Government ‚ÄúBaltimore County is a far better place today thanks to his many years of service. My prayers and condolences are with his family and loved ones during this trying time,‚Äù he said.
